  6272                                     True, &n_monitors);
  6273       if (!rr_monitors)
  6274         goto fallback;
  6275 
  6276       monitors = xzalloc (n_monitors * sizeof *monitors);
  6277 #ifdef USE_XCB
  6278       atom_name_cookies = alloca (n_monitors * sizeof *atom_name_cookies);
  6279 #endif
  6280 
  6281       for (int i = 0; i < n_monitors; ++i)
  6282         {
  6283           monitors[i].geom.x = rr_monitors[i].x;
  6284           monitors[i].geom.y = rr_monitors[i].y;
  6285           monitors[i].geom.width = rr_monitors[i].width;
  6286           monitors[i].geom.height = rr_monitors[i].height;
  6287           monitors[i].mm_width = rr_monitors[i].mwidth;
  6288           monitors[i].mm_height = rr_monitors[i].mheight;
  6289 
  6290 #ifndef USE_XCB
  6291           name = XGetAtomName (dpyinfo->display, rr_monitors[i].name);
  6292           if (name)
  6293             {
  6294               monitors[i].name = xstrdup (name);
  6295               XFree (name);
  6296             }
  6297           else
  6298             monitors[i].name = xstrdup ("Unknown Monitor");
  6299 #else
  6300           atom_name_cookies[i]
  6301             = xcb_get_atom_name (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  6302                                  (xcb_atom_t) rr_monitors[i].name);
  6303 #endif
  6304 
  6305           if (rr_monitors[i].primary)
  6306             primary = i;
  6307 
  6308           if (rr_monitors[i].primary
  6309               && x_get_net_workarea (dpyinfo, &workarea))
  6310             {
  6311               monitors[i].work = workarea;
  6312               if (!gui_intersect_rectangles (&monitors[i].geom,
  6313                                              &monitors[i].work,
  6314                                              &monitors[i].work))
  6315                 monitors[i].work = monitors[i].geom;
  6316             }
  6317           else
  6318             monitors[i].work = monitors[i].geom;
  6319         }
  6320 
  6321 #ifdef USE_XCB
  6322       for (int i = 0; i < n_monitors; ++i)
  6323         {
  6324           reply = xcb_get_atom_name_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  6325                                            atom_name_cookies[i], &error);
  6326 
  6327           if (!reply)
  6328             {
  6329               monitors[i].name = xstrdup ("Unknown monitor");
  6330               free (error);
  6331             }
  6332           else
  6333             {
  6334               length = xcb_get_atom_name_name_length (reply);
  6335               name = xmalloc (length + 1);
  6336               memcpy (name, xcb_get_atom_name_name (reply), length);
  6337               name[length] = '\0';
  6338               monitors[i].name = name;
  6339               free (reply);
  6340             }
  6341         }
  6342 #endif
  6343 
  6344       XRRFreeMonitors (rr_monitors);
  6345       randr15_p = true;
  6346       goto out;
  6347     }
  6348 
  6349  fallback:;
  6350 #endif
  6351 
  6352 #define RANDR13_LIBRARY \
  6353   (RANDR_MAJOR > 1 || (RANDR_MAJOR == 1 && RANDR_MINOR >= 3))
  6354 
  6355 #if RANDR13_LIBRARY
  6356   /* Check if the display supports 1.3 too.  */
  6357   bool randr13_avail = (dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version > 1
  6358                         || (dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version == 1
  6359                             && dpyinfo->xrandr_minor_version >= 3));
  6360 
  6361   if (randr13_avail)
  6362     resources = XRRGetScreenResourcesCurrent (dpy, dpyinfo->root_window);
  6363   else
  6364     resources = XRRGetScreenResources (dpy, dpyinfo->root_window);
  6365 #else
  6366   resources = XRRGetScreenResources (dpy, dpyinfo->root_window);
  6367 #endif
  6368   if (! resources || resources->noutput == 0)
  6369     {
  6370       if (resources)
  6371         XRRFreeScreenResources (resources);
  6372       return Qnil;
  6373     }
  6374   n_monitors = resources->noutput;
  6375   monitors = xzalloc (n_monitors * sizeof *monitors);
  6376 
  6377 #if RANDR13_LIBRARY
  6378   if (randr13_avail)
  6379     pxid = XRRGetOutputPrimary (dpy, dpyinfo->root_window);
  6380 #endif
  6381 
  6382 #undef RANDR13_LIBRARY
  6383 
  6384   for (i = 0; i < n_monitors; ++i)
  6385     {
  6386       XRROutputInfo *info = XRRGetOutputInfo (dpy, resources,
  6387                                               resources->outputs[i]);
  6388       if (!info)
  6389         continue;
  6390 
  6391       if (strcmp (info->name, "default") == 0)
  6392         {
  6393           /* Non XRandr 1.2 driver, does not give useful data.  */
  6394           XRRFreeOutputInfo (info);
  6395           XRRFreeScreenResources (resources);
  6396           free_monitors (monitors, n_monitors);
  6397           return Qnil;
  6398         }
  6399 
  6400       if (info->connection != RR_Disconnected && info->crtc != None)
  6401         {
  6402           XRRCrtcInfo *crtc = XRRGetCrtcInfo (dpy, resources, info->crtc);
  6403           struct MonitorInfo *mi = &monitors[i];
  6404           XRectangle workarea_r;
  6405 
  6406           if (! crtc)
  6407             {
  6408               XRRFreeOutputInfo (info);
  6409               continue;
  6410             }
  6411 
  6412           mi->geom.x = crtc->x;
  6413           mi->geom.y = crtc->y;
  6414           mi->geom.width = crtc->width;
  6415           mi->geom.height = crtc->height;
  6416           mi->mm_width = info->mm_width;
  6417           mi->mm_height = info->mm_height;
  6418           mi->name = xstrdup (info->name);
  6419 
  6420           if (pxid != None && pxid == resources->outputs[i])
  6421             primary = i;
  6422           else if (primary == -1 && strcmp (info->name, "LVDS") == 0)
  6423             primary = i;
  6424 
  6425           if (i == primary && x_get_net_workarea (dpyinfo, &workarea_r))
  6426             {
  6427               mi->work= workarea_r;
  6428               if (! gui_intersect_rectangles (&mi->geom, &mi->work, &mi->work))
  6429                 mi->work = mi->geom;
  6430             }
  6431           else
  6432             mi->work = mi->geom;
  6433 
  6434           XRRFreeCrtcInfo (crtc);
  6435         }
  6436       XRRFreeOutputInfo (info);
  6437     }
  6438   XRRFreeScreenResources (resources);
  6439 #if RANDR_MAJOR > 1 || (RANDR_MAJOR == 1 && RANDR_MINOR >= 5)
  6440  out:
  6441 #endif
  6442   attributes_list = x_make_monitor_attribute_list (monitors,
  6443                                                    n_monitors,
  6444                                                    primary,
  6445                                                    dpyinfo,
  6446                                                    (randr15_p
  6447                                                     ? "XRandR 1.5"
  6448                                                     : "XRandr"));
  6449   free_monitors (monitors, n_monitors);
  6450   return attributes_list;
  6451 }
  6452 #endif /* HAVE_XRANDR */
  6453 
  6454 static Lisp_Object
  6455 x_get_monitor_attributes (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
  6456 {
  6457   Lisp_Object attributes_list = Qnil;
  6458   Display *dpy = dpyinfo->display;
  6459 
  6460   (void) dpy; /* Suppress unused variable warning.  */
  6461 
  6462 #ifdef HAVE_XRANDR
  6463   bool xrr_ok = ((dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version == 1
  6464                   && dpyinfo->xrandr_minor_version >= 2)
  6465                  || dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version > 1);
  6466 
  6467   if (xrr_ok)
  6468     attributes_list = x_get_monitor_attributes_xrandr (dpyinfo);
  6469 #endif /* HAVE_XRANDR */
  6470 
  6471 #ifdef HAVE_XINERAMA
  6472   if (NILP (attributes_list))
  6473     {
  6474       if (dpyinfo->xinerama_supported_p && XineramaIsActive (dpy))
  6475         attributes_list = x_get_monitor_attributes_xinerama (dpyinfo);
  6476     }
  6477 #endif /* HAVE_XINERAMA */
  6478 
  6479   if (NILP (attributes_list))
  6480     attributes_list = x_get_monitor_attributes_fallback (dpyinfo);
  6481 
  6482   return attributes_list;
  6483 }
  6484 
  6485 #endif /* !USE_GTK */
  6486 
  6487 #ifdef USE_LUCID
  6488 /* This is used by the Lucid menu widget, but it's defined here so we
  6489    can make use of a great deal of existing code.  */
  6490 static void
  6491 xlw_monitor_dimensions_at_pos_1 (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  6492                                  Screen *screen, int src_x, int src_y,
  6493                                  int *x, int *y, int *width, int *height)
  6494 {
  6495   Lisp_Object attrs, tem, val;
  6496 
  6497   attrs = x_get_monitor_attributes (dpyinfo);
  6498 
  6499   for (tem = attrs; CONSP (tem); tem = XCDR (tem))
  6500     {
  6501       int sx, sy, swidth, sheight;
  6502       val = assq_no_quit (Qworkarea, XCAR (tem));
  6503       if (!NILP (val))
  6504         {
  6505           sx = XFIXNUM (XCAR (XCDR (val)));
  6506           sy = XFIXNUM (XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (val))));
  6507           swidth = XFIXNUM (XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (XCDR (val)))));
  6508           sheight = XFIXNUM (XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (XCDR (XCDR (val))))));
  6509 
  6510           if (sx <= src_x && src_x < (sx + swidth)
  6511               && sy <= src_y && src_y < (sy + swidth))
  6512             {
  6513               *x = sx;
  6514               *y = sy;
  6515               *width = swidth;
  6516               *height = sheight;
  6517               return;
  6518             }
  6519         }
  6520     }
  6521 
  6522   *x = 0;
  6523   *y = 0;
  6524   *width = WidthOfScreen (screen);
  6525   *height = HeightOfScreen (screen);
  6526 }
  6527 
  6528 void
  6529 xlw_monitor_dimensions_at_pos (Display *dpy, Screen *screen, int src_x,
  6530                                int src_y, int *x, int *y, int *width, int *height)
  6531 {
  6532   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
  6533 
  6534   if (!dpyinfo)
  6535     emacs_abort ();
  6536 
  6537   block_input ();
  6538   xlw_monitor_dimensions_at_pos_1 (dpyinfo, screen, src_x, src_y,
  6539                                    x, y, width, height);
  6540 
  6541   unblock_input ();
  6542 }
  6543 #endif
  6544 
  6545 
  6546 DEFUN ("x-display-monitor-attributes-list", Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list,
  6547        Sx_display_monitor_attributes_list,
  6548        0, 1, 0,
  6549        doc: /* Return a list of physical monitor attributes on the X display TERMINAL.
  6550 
  6551 The optional argument TERMINAL specifies which display to ask about.
  6552 TERMINAL should be a terminal object, a frame or a display name (a string).
  6553 If omitted or nil, that stands for the selected frame's display.
  6554 
  6555 In addition to the standard attribute keys listed in
  6556 `display-monitor-attributes-list', the following keys are contained in
  6557 the attributes:
  6558 
  6559  source -- String describing the source from which multi-monitor
  6560            information is obtained, one of \"Gdk\", \"XRandR 1.5\",
  6561            \"XRandr\", \"Xinerama\", or \"fallback\"
  6562 
  6563 Internal use only, use `display-monitor-attributes-list' instead.  */)
  6564   (Lisp_Object terminal)
  6565 {
  6566   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
  6567   Lisp_Object attributes_list = Qnil;
  6568 
  6569 #ifdef USE_GTK
  6570   GdkDisplay *gdpy;
  6571 #if ! GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6572   double mm_width_per_pixel, mm_height_per_pixel;
  6573   GdkScreen *gscreen;
  6574 #endif
  6575   gint primary_monitor = 0, n_monitors, i;
  6576   Lisp_Object monitor_frames, rest, frame;
  6577   static const char *source = "Gdk";
  6578   struct MonitorInfo *monitors;
  6579 
  6580   block_input ();
  6581   gdpy = gdk_x11_lookup_xdisplay (dpyinfo->display);
  6582 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6583   n_monitors = gdk_display_get_n_monitors (gdpy);
  6584 #else
  6585   gscreen = gdk_display_get_default_screen (gdpy);
  6586   n_monitors = gdk_screen_get_n_monitors (gscreen);
  6587   primary_monitor = gdk_screen_get_primary_monitor (gscreen);
  6588   /* Fallback if gdk_screen_get_monitor_{width,height}_mm fail */
  6589   mm_width_per_pixel = ((double) WidthMMOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen)
  6590                         / x_display_pixel_width (dpyinfo));
  6591   mm_height_per_pixel = ((double) HeightMMOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen)
  6592                          / x_display_pixel_height (dpyinfo));
  6593 #endif
  6594   monitor_frames = make_nil_vector (n_monitors);
  6595   monitors = xzalloc (n_monitors * sizeof *monitors);
  6596 
  6597   FOR_EACH_FRAME (rest, frame)
  6598     {
  6599       struct frame *f = XFRAME (frame);
  6600 
  6601       if (FRAME_X_P (f)
  6602           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) == dpyinfo
  6603           && !FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f))
  6604         {
  6605           GdkWindow *gwin = gtk_widget_get_window (FRAME_GTK_WIDGET (f));
  6606 
  6607 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6608           for (i = 0; i < n_monitors; i++)
  6609             if (gdk_display_get_monitor_at_window (gdpy, gwin)
  6610                 == gdk_display_get_monitor (gdpy, i))
  6611               break;
  6612 #else
  6613           i = gdk_screen_get_monitor_at_window (gscreen, gwin);
  6614 #endif
  6615           ASET (monitor_frames, i, Fcons (frame, AREF (monitor_frames, i)));
  6616         }
  6617     }
  6618 
  6619   for (i = 0; i < n_monitors; ++i)
  6620     {
  6621       gint width_mm, height_mm;
  6622       GdkRectangle rec, work;
  6623       struct MonitorInfo *mi = &monitors[i];
  6624       int scale = 1;
  6625 
  6626 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6627       GdkMonitor *monitor = gdk_display_get_monitor (gdpy, i);
  6628       if (gdk_monitor_is_primary (monitor))
  6629         primary_monitor = i;
  6630       gdk_monitor_get_geometry (monitor, &rec);
  6631 #else
  6632       gdk_screen_get_monitor_geometry (gscreen, i, &rec);
  6633 #endif
  6634 
  6635 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6636       width_mm = gdk_monitor_get_width_mm (monitor);
  6637       height_mm = gdk_monitor_get_height_mm (monitor);
  6638 #else
  6639       width_mm = gdk_screen_get_monitor_width_mm (gscreen, i);
  6640       height_mm = gdk_screen_get_monitor_height_mm (gscreen, i);
  6641       if (width_mm < 0)
  6642         width_mm = rec.width * mm_width_per_pixel + 0.5;
  6643       if (height_mm < 0)
  6644         height_mm = rec.height * mm_height_per_pixel + 0.5;
  6645 #endif
  6646 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6647       gdk_monitor_get_workarea (monitor, &work);
  6648 #elif defined HAVE_GTK3
  6649       gdk_screen_get_monitor_workarea (gscreen, i, &work);
  6650 #else
  6651       /* Emulate the behavior of GTK+ 3.4.  */
  6652       {
  6653         XRectangle workarea_r;
  6654 
  6655         if (i == primary_monitor && x_get_net_workarea (dpyinfo, &workarea_r))
  6656           {
  6657             work.x = workarea_r.x;
  6658             work.y = workarea_r.y;
  6659             work.width = workarea_r.width;
  6660             work.height = workarea_r.height;
  6661             if (! gdk_rectangle_intersect (&rec, &work, &work))
  6662               work = rec;
  6663           }
  6664         else
  6665           work = rec;
  6666       }
  6667 #endif
  6668 
  6669       /* GTK returns scaled sizes for the workareas.  */
  6670 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6671       scale = gdk_monitor_get_scale_factor (monitor);
  6672 #elif defined HAVE_GTK3
  6673       scale = gdk_screen_get_monitor_scale_factor (gscreen, i);
  6674 #endif
  6675       rec.x *= scale;
  6676       rec.y *= scale;
  6677       rec.width *= scale;
  6678       rec.height *= scale;
  6679       work.x *= scale;
  6680       work.y *= scale;
  6681       work.width *= scale;
  6682       work.height *= scale;
  6683 
  6684       mi->geom.x = rec.x;
  6685       mi->geom.y = rec.y;
  6686       mi->geom.width = rec.width;
  6687       mi->geom.height = rec.height;
  6688       mi->work.x = work.x;
  6689       mi->work.y = work.y;
  6690       mi->work.width = work.width;
  6691       mi->work.height = work.height;
  6692       mi->mm_width = width_mm;
  6693       mi->mm_height = height_mm;
  6694 
  6695 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 22, 0)
  6696       dupstring (&mi->name, (gdk_monitor_get_model (monitor)));
  6697 #else
  6698       mi->name = gdk_screen_get_monitor_plug_name (gscreen, i);
  6699 #endif
  6700     }
  6701 
  6702   attributes_list = make_monitor_attribute_list (monitors,
  6703                                                  n_monitors,
  6704                                                  primary_monitor,
  6705                                                  monitor_frames,
  6706                                                  source);
  6707   free_monitors (monitors, n_monitors);
  6708   unblock_input ();
  6709 #else  /* not USE_GTK */
  6710 
  6711   block_input ();
  6712   attributes_list = x_get_monitor_attributes (dpyinfo);
  6713   unblock_input ();
  6714 
  6715 #endif  /* not USE_GTK */
  6716 
  6717   return attributes_list;
  6718 }
  6719 
  6720 /* Return geometric attributes of FRAME.  According to the value of
  6721    ATTRIBUTES return the outer edges of FRAME (Qouter_edges), the
  6722    native edges of FRAME (Qnative_edges), or the inner edges of frame
  6723    (Qinner_edges).  Any other value means to return the geometry as
  6724    returned by Fx_frame_geometry.  */
  6725 
  6726 static Lisp_Object
  6727 frame_geometry (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object attribute)
  6728 {
  6729   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
  6730   /**   XWindowAttributes atts; **/
  6731   Window rootw;
  6732   unsigned int ign, native_width, native_height, x_border_width = 0;
  6733   int x_native = 0, y_native = 0, xptr = 0, yptr = 0;
  6734   int left_off = 0, right_off = 0, top_off = 0, bottom_off = 0;
  6735   int outer_left, outer_top, outer_right, outer_bottom;
  6736   int native_left, native_top, native_right, native_bottom;
  6737   int inner_left, inner_top, inner_right, inner_bottom;
  6738   int internal_border_width;
  6739   bool menu_bar_external = false, tool_bar_external = false;
  6740   int menu_bar_height = 0, menu_bar_width = 0;
  6741   int tab_bar_height = 0, tab_bar_width = 0;
  6742   int tool_bar_height = 0, tool_bar_width = 0;
  6743 
  6744   if (FRAME_INITIAL_P (f) || !FRAME_X_P (f) || !FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  6745     return Qnil;
  6746 
  6747   block_input ();
  6748   XGetGeometry (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  6749                 &rootw, &x_native, &y_native, &native_width, &native_height,
  6750                 &x_border_width, &ign);
  6751   /**   XGetWindowAttributes (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f), &atts); **/
  6752   if (!FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
  6753     x_real_pos_and_offsets (f, &left_off, &right_off, &top_off, &bottom_off,
  6754                             NULL, NULL, &xptr, &yptr, NULL);
  6755   unblock_input ();
  6756 
  6757   /**   native_width = atts.width; **/
  6758   /**   native_height = atts.height; **/
  6759 
  6760   if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
  6761     {
  6762       Lisp_Object parent, edges;
  6763 
  6764       XSETFRAME (parent, FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f));
  6765       edges = Fx_frame_edges (parent, Qnative_edges);
  6766       if (!NILP (edges))
  6767         {
  6768           x_native += XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (0), edges));
  6769           y_native += XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (1), edges));
  6770         }
  6771 
  6772       outer_left = x_native;
  6773       outer_top = y_native;
  6774       outer_right = outer_left + native_width + 2 * x_border_width;
  6775       outer_bottom = outer_top + native_height + 2 * x_border_width;
  6776 
  6777       native_left = x_native + x_border_width;
  6778       native_top = y_native + x_border_width;
  6779       native_right = native_left + native_width;
  6780       native_bottom = native_top + native_height;
  6781     }
  6782   else
  6783     {
  6784       outer_left = xptr;
  6785       outer_top = yptr;
  6786       outer_right = outer_left + left_off + native_width + right_off;
  6787       outer_bottom = outer_top + top_off + native_height + bottom_off;
  6788 
  6789       native_left = outer_left + left_off;
  6790       native_top = outer_top + top_off;
  6791       native_right = native_left + native_width;
  6792       native_bottom = native_top + native_height;
  6793     }
  6794 
  6795   internal_border_width = FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f);
  6796   inner_left = native_left + internal_border_width;
  6797   inner_top = native_top + internal_border_width;
  6798   inner_right = native_right - internal_border_width;
  6799   inner_bottom = native_bottom - internal_border_width;
  6800 
  6801 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_MENU_BAR
  6802   menu_bar_external = true;
  6803   menu_bar_height = FRAME_MENUBAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6804   native_top += menu_bar_height;
  6805   inner_top += menu_bar_height;
  6806 #else
  6807   menu_bar_height = FRAME_MENU_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6808   inner_top += menu_bar_height;
  6809 #endif
  6810   menu_bar_width = menu_bar_height ? native_width : 0;
  6811 
  6812   tab_bar_height = FRAME_TAB_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6813   tab_bar_width = (tab_bar_height
  6814                    ? native_width - 2 * internal_border_width
  6815                    : 0);
  6816   inner_top += tab_bar_height;
  6817 
  6818 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
  6819   tool_bar_external = true;
  6820   if (EQ (FRAME_TOOL_BAR_POSITION (f), Qleft))
  6821     {
  6822       tool_bar_width = FRAME_TOOLBAR_WIDTH (f);
  6823       native_left += tool_bar_width;
  6824       inner_left += tool_bar_width;
  6825       tool_bar_height
  6826         = tool_bar_width ? native_height - menu_bar_height : 0;
  6827     }
  6828   else if (EQ (FRAME_TOOL_BAR_POSITION (f), Qtop))
  6829     {
  6830       tool_bar_height = FRAME_TOOLBAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6831       native_top += tool_bar_height;
  6832       inner_top += tool_bar_height;
  6833       tool_bar_width = tool_bar_height ? native_width : 0;
  6834     }
  6835   else if (EQ (FRAME_TOOL_BAR_POSITION (f), Qright))
  6836     {
  6837       tool_bar_width = FRAME_TOOLBAR_WIDTH (f);
  6838       native_right -= tool_bar_width;
  6839       inner_right -= tool_bar_width;
  6840       tool_bar_height
  6841         = tool_bar_width ? native_height - menu_bar_height : 0;
  6842     }
  6843   else
  6844     {
  6845       tool_bar_height = FRAME_TOOLBAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6846       native_bottom -= tool_bar_height;
  6847       inner_bottom -= tool_bar_height;
  6848       tool_bar_width = tool_bar_height ? native_width : 0;
  6849     }
  6850 #else
  6851   tool_bar_height = FRAME_TOOL_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  6852   tool_bar_width = (tool_bar_height
  6853                     ? native_width - 2 * internal_border_width
  6854                     : 0);
  6855 
  6856   /* Subtract or add to the inner dimensions based on the tool bar
  6857      position.  */
  6858 
  6859   if (EQ (FRAME_TOOL_BAR_POSITION (f), Qtop))
  6860     inner_top += tool_bar_height;
  6861   else
  6862     inner_bottom -= tool_bar_height;
  6863 #endif
  6864 
  6865   /* Construct list.  */
  6866   if (EQ (attribute, Qouter_edges))
  6867     return list4i (outer_left, outer_top, outer_right, outer_bottom);
  6868   else if (EQ (attribute, Qnative_edges))
  6869     return list4i (native_left, native_top, native_right, native_bottom);
  6870   else if (EQ (attribute, Qinner_edges))
  6871     return list4i (inner_left, inner_top, inner_right, inner_bottom);
  6872   else
  6873     return
  6874        list (Fcons (Qouter_position,
  6875                     Fcons (make_fixnum (outer_left),
  6876                            make_fixnum (outer_top))),
  6877              Fcons (Qouter_size,
  6878                     Fcons (make_fixnum (outer_right - outer_left),
  6879                            make_fixnum (outer_bottom - outer_top))),
  6880              /* Approximate.  */
  6881              Fcons (Qexternal_border_size,
  6882                     Fcons (make_fixnum (right_off),
  6883                            make_fixnum (bottom_off))),
  6884              Fcons (Qouter_border_width, make_fixnum (x_border_width)),
  6885              /* Approximate.  */
  6886              Fcons (Qtitle_bar_size,
  6887                     Fcons (make_fixnum (0),
  6888                            make_fixnum (top_off - bottom_off))),
  6889              Fcons (Qmenu_bar_external, menu_bar_external ? Qt : Qnil),
  6890              Fcons (Qmenu_bar_size,
  6891                     Fcons (make_fixnum (menu_bar_width),
  6892                            make_fixnum (menu_bar_height))),
  6893              Fcons (Qtab_bar_size,
  6894                     Fcons (make_fixnum (tab_bar_width),
  6895                            make_fixnum (tab_bar_height))),
  6896              Fcons (Qtool_bar_external, tool_bar_external ? Qt : Qnil),
  6897              Fcons (Qtool_bar_position, FRAME_TOOL_BAR_POSITION (f)),
  6898              Fcons (Qtool_bar_size,
  6899                     Fcons (make_fixnum (tool_bar_width),
  6900                            make_fixnum (tool_bar_height))),
  6901              Fcons (Qinternal_border_width,
  6902                     make_fixnum (internal_border_width)));
  6903 }
  6904 
  6905 DEFUN ("x-frame-geometry", Fx_frame_geometry, Sx_frame_geometry, 0, 1, 0,
  6906        doc: /* Return geometric attributes of FRAME.
  6907 FRAME must be a live frame and defaults to the selected one.  The return
  6908 value is an association list of the attributes listed below.  All height
  6909 and width values are in pixels.
  6910 
  6911 `outer-position' is a cons of the outer left and top edges of FRAME
  6912   relative to the origin - the position (0, 0) - of FRAME's display.
  6913 
  6914 `outer-size' is a cons of the outer width and height of FRAME.  The
  6915   outer size includes the title bar and the external borders as well as
  6916   any menu and/or tool bar of frame.  For a child frame the value
  6917   includes FRAME's X borders, if any.
  6918 
  6919 `external-border-size' is a cons of the horizontal and vertical width of
  6920   FRAME's external borders as supplied by the window manager.
  6921 
  6922 `title-bar-size' is a cons of the width and height of the title bar of
  6923   FRAME as supplied by the window manager.  If both of them are zero,
  6924   FRAME has no title bar.  If only the width is zero, Emacs was not
  6925   able to retrieve the width information.
  6926 
  6927 `menu-bar-external', if non-nil, means the menu bar is external (never
  6928   included in the inner edges of FRAME).
  6929 
  6930 `menu-bar-size' is a cons of the width and height of the menu bar of
  6931   FRAME.
  6932 
  6933 `tool-bar-external', if non-nil, means the tool bar is external (never
  6934   included in the inner edges of FRAME).
  6935 
  6936 `tool-bar-position' tells on which side the tool bar on FRAME is and can
  6937   be one of `left', `top', `right' or `bottom'.  If this is nil, FRAME
  6938   has no tool bar.
  6939 
  6940 `tool-bar-size' is a cons of the width and height of the tool bar of
  6941   FRAME.
  6942 
  6943 `internal-border-width' is the width of the internal border of
  6944   FRAME.
  6945 
  6946 `outer-border-width' is the width of the X border of FRAME.  The X
  6947   border is usually shown only for frames without window manager
  6948   decorations, such as child and tooltip frames.  */)
  6949   (Lisp_Object frame)
  6950 {
  6951   return frame_geometry (frame, Qnil);
  6952 }
  6953 
  6954 DEFUN ("x-frame-edges", Fx_frame_edges, Sx_frame_edges, 0, 2, 0,
  6955        doc: /* Return edge coordinates of FRAME.
  6956 FRAME must be a live frame and defaults to the selected one.  The return
  6957 value is a list of the form (LEFT, TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM).  All values are
  6958 in pixels relative to the origin - the position (0, 0) - of FRAME's
  6959 display.
  6960 
  6961 If optional argument TYPE is the symbol `outer-edges', return the outer
  6962 edges of FRAME.  The outer edges comprise the decorations of the window
  6963 manager (like the title bar or external borders) as well as any external
  6964 menu or tool bar of FRAME.  If optional argument TYPE is the symbol
  6965 `native-edges' or nil, return the native edges of FRAME.  The native
  6966 edges exclude the decorations of the window manager and any external
  6967 menu or tool bar of FRAME.  If TYPE is the symbol `inner-edges', return
  6968 the inner edges of FRAME.  These edges exclude title bar, any borders,
  6969 menu bar or tool bar of FRAME.  */)
  6970   (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object type)
  6971 {
  6972   return frame_geometry (frame, ((EQ (type, Qouter_edges)
  6973                                   || EQ (type, Qinner_edges))
  6974                                  ? type
  6975                                  : Qnative_edges));
  6976 }
  6977 
  6978 /**
  6979  * x_frame_list_z_order:
  6980  *
  6981  * Recursively add list of all frames on the display specified via
  6982  * DPYINFO and whose window-system window's parent is specified by
  6983  * WINDOW to FRAMES and return FRAMES.
  6984  */
  6985 static Lisp_Object
  6986 x_frame_list_z_order (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Window window)
  6987 {
  6988   Display *dpy;
  6989   Window root, parent, *children;
  6990   unsigned int nchildren;
  6991   unsigned long i;
  6992   Lisp_Object frames, val;
  6993   Atom type;
  6994   Window *toplevels;
  6995   int format, rc;
  6996   unsigned long nitems, bytes_after;
  6997   unsigned char *data;
  6998   struct frame *f;
  6999 
  7000   dpy = dpyinfo->display;
  7001   data = NULL;
  7002   frames = Qnil;
  7003 
  7004   if (window == dpyinfo->root_window
  7005       && x_wm_supports_1 (dpyinfo,
  7006                           dpyinfo->Xatom_net_client_list_stacking))
  7007     {
  7008       rc = XGetWindowProperty (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window,
  7009                                dpyinfo->Xatom_net_client_list_stacking,
  7010                                0, LONG_MAX, False, XA_WINDOW, &type,
  7011                                &format, &nitems, &bytes_after, &data);
  7012 
  7013       if (rc != Success)
  7014         return Qnil;
  7015 
  7016       if (format != 32 || type != XA_WINDOW)
  7017         {
  7018           XFree (data);
  7019           return Qnil;
  7020         }
  7021 
  7022       toplevels = (Window *) data;
  7023 
  7024       for (i = 0; i < nitems; ++i)
  7025         {
  7026           f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, toplevels[i]);
  7027 
  7028           if (f)
  7029             {
  7030               XSETFRAME (val, f);
  7031               frames = Fcons (val, frames);
  7032             }
  7033         }
  7034 
  7035       XFree (data);
  7036       return frames;
  7037     }
  7038 
  7039   if (XQueryTree (dpy, window, &root, &parent, &children, &nchildren))
  7040     {
  7041       for (i = 0; i < nchildren; i++)
  7042         {
  7043           Lisp_Object frame, tail;
  7044 
  7045           FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
  7046             {
  7047               struct frame *cf = XFRAME (frame);
  7048               /* With a reparenting window manager the parent_desc
  7049                  field usually specifies the topmost windows of our
  7050                  frames.  Otherwise FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW should do.  */
  7051               if (FRAME_X_P (cf)
  7052                   && (cf->output_data.x->parent_desc == children[i]
  7053                       || FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (cf) == children[i]))
  7054                 frames = Fcons (frame, frames);
  7055             }
  7056         }
  7057 
  7058       if (children)
  7059         XFree (children);
  7060     }
  7061 
  7062   return frames;
  7063 }
  7064 
  7065 
  7066 DEFUN ("x-frame-list-z-order", Fx_frame_list_z_order,
  7067        Sx_frame_list_z_order, 0, 1, 0,
  7068        doc: /* Return list of Emacs' frames, in Z (stacking) order.
  7069 The optional argument TERMINAL specifies which display to ask about.
  7070 TERMINAL should be either a frame or a display name (a string).  If
  7071 omitted or nil, that stands for the selected frame's display.  Return
  7072 nil if TERMINAL contains no Emacs frame.
  7073 
  7074 As a special case, if TERMINAL is non-nil and specifies a live frame,
  7075 return the child frames of that frame in Z (stacking) order.
  7076 
  7077 Frames are listed from topmost (first) to bottommost (last).  */)
  7078   (Lisp_Object terminal)
  7079 {
  7080   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
  7081   Window window;
  7082 
  7083   if (FRAMEP (terminal) && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (terminal)))
  7084     window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (XFRAME (terminal));
  7085   else
  7086     window = dpyinfo->root_window;
  7087 
  7088   return x_frame_list_z_order (dpyinfo, window);
  7089 }
  7090 
  7091 /**
  7092  * x_frame_restack:
  7093  *
  7094  * Restack frame F1 below frame F2, above if ABOVE_FLAG is non-nil.  In
  7095  * practice this is a two-step action: The first step removes F1's
  7096  * window-system window from the display.  The second step reinserts
  7097  * F1's window below (above if ABOVE_FLAG is true) that of F2.
  7098  */
  7099 static void
  7100 x_frame_restack (struct frame *f1, struct frame *f2, bool above_flag)
  7101 {
  7102 #ifdef USE_GTK
  7103   block_input ();
  7104   xg_frame_restack (f1, f2, above_flag);
  7105   unblock_input ();
  7106 #else
  7107   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f1);
  7108   Window window1 = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f1);
  7109   XWindowChanges wc;
  7110   unsigned long mask = (CWSibling | CWStackMode);
  7111 
  7112   wc.sibling = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f2);
  7113   wc.stack_mode = above_flag ? Above : Below;
  7114   block_input ();
  7115   /* Configure the window manager window (a normal XConfigureWindow
  7116      won't cut it).  This should also work for child frames.  */
  7117   XReconfigureWMWindow (dpy, window1, FRAME_X_SCREEN_NUMBER (f1), mask, &wc);
  7118   unblock_input ();
  7119 #endif /* USE_GTK */
  7120 }
  7121 
  7122 
  7123 DEFUN ("x-frame-restack", Fx_frame_restack, Sx_frame_restack, 2, 3, 0,
  7124        doc: /* Restack FRAME1 below FRAME2.
  7125 This means that if both frames are visible and the display areas of
  7126 these frames overlap, FRAME2 (partially) obscures FRAME1.  If optional
  7127 third argument ABOVE is non-nil, restack FRAME1 above FRAME2.  This
  7128 means that if both frames are visible and the display areas of these
  7129 frames overlap, FRAME1 (partially) obscures FRAME2.
  7130 
  7131 This may be thought of as an atomic action performed in two steps: The
  7132 first step removes FRAME1's window-step window from the display.  The
  7133 second step reinserts FRAME1's window below (above if ABOVE is true)
  7134 that of FRAME2.  Hence the position of FRAME2 in its display's Z
  7135 \(stacking) order relative to all other frames excluding FRAME1 remains
  7136 unaltered.
  7137 
  7138 Some window managers may refuse to restack windows.  */)
  7139      (Lisp_Object frame1, Lisp_Object frame2, Lisp_Object above)
  7140 {
  7141   struct frame *f1 = decode_live_frame (frame1);
  7142   struct frame *f2 = decode_live_frame (frame2);
  7143 
  7144   if (! (FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f1) && FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f2)))
  7145     error ("Cannot restack frames");
  7146   x_frame_restack (f1, f2, !NILP (above));
  7147   return Qt;
  7148 }
  7149 
  7150 
  7151 DEFUN ("x-mouse-absolute-pixel-position", Fx_mouse_absolute_pixel_position,
  7152        Sx_mouse_absolute_pixel_position, 0, 0, 0,
  7153        doc: /* Return absolute position of mouse cursor in pixels.
  7154 The position is returned as a cons cell (X . Y) of the coordinates of
  7155 the mouse cursor position in pixels relative to a position (0, 0) of the
  7156 selected frame's display.  */)
  7157   (void)
  7158 {
  7159   struct frame *f = SELECTED_FRAME ();
  7160   Window root, dummy_window;
  7161   int x, y, dummy;
  7162 
  7163   if (FRAME_INITIAL_P (f) || !FRAME_X_P (f))
  7164     return Qnil;
  7165 
  7166   block_input ();
  7167   x_query_pointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7168                    FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  7169                    &root, &dummy_window, &x, &y, &dummy, &dummy,
  7170                    (unsigned int *) &dummy);
  7171   unblock_input ();
  7172 
  7173   return Fcons (make_fixnum (x), make_fixnum (y));
  7174 }
  7175 
  7176 DEFUN ("x-set-mouse-absolute-pixel-position", Fx_set_mouse_absolute_pixel_position,
  7177        Sx_set_mouse_absolute_pixel_position, 2, 2, 0,
  7178        doc: /* Move mouse pointer to absolute pixel position (X, Y).
  7179 The coordinates X and Y are interpreted in pixels relative to a position
  7180 \(0, 0) of the selected frame's display.  */)
  7181   (Lisp_Object x, Lisp_Object y)
  7182 {
  7183   struct frame *f = SELECTED_FRAME ();
  7184 
  7185   if (FRAME_INITIAL_P (f) || !FRAME_X_P (f))
  7186     return Qnil;
  7187 
  7188   int xval = check_integer_range (x, INT_MIN, INT_MAX);
  7189   int yval = check_integer_range (y, INT_MIN, INT_MAX);
  7190 
  7191   block_input ();
  7192 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
  7193   int deviceid;
  7194 
  7195   deviceid = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->client_pointer_device;
  7196 
  7197   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2
  7198       && deviceid != -1)
  7199     {
  7200       x_catch_errors_for_lisp (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  7201       XIWarpPointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), deviceid, None,
  7202                      FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  7203                      0, 0, 0, 0, xval, yval);
  7204       x_uncatch_errors_for_lisp (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  7205     }
  7206   else
  7207 #endif
  7208     XWarpPointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), None,
  7209                   FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  7210                   0, 0, 0, 0, xval, yval);
  7211   unblock_input ();
  7212 
  7213   return Qnil;
  7214 }
  7215 
  7216 DEFUN ("x-begin-drag", Fx_begin_drag, Sx_begin_drag, 1, 6, 0,
  7217        doc: /* Begin dragging contents on FRAME, with targets TARGETS.
  7218 TARGETS is a list of strings, which defines the X selection targets
  7219 that will be available to the drop target.  Block until the mouse
  7220 buttons are released, then return the action chosen by the target, or
  7221 `nil' if the drop was not accepted by the drop target.  Dragging
  7222 starts when the mouse is pressed on FRAME, and the contents of the
  7223 selection `XdndSelection' will be sent to the X window underneath the
  7224 mouse pointer (the drop target) when the mouse button is released.
  7225 
  7226 ACTION is a symbol which tells the target what it should do, and can
  7227 be one of the following:
  7228 
  7229  - `XdndActionCopy', which means to copy the contents from the drag
  7230    source (FRAME) to the drop target.
  7231 
  7232  - `XdndActionMove', which means to first take the contents of
  7233    `XdndSelection', and to delete whatever was saved into that
  7234    selection afterwards.
  7235 
  7236 `XdndActionPrivate' is also a valid return value, and means that the
  7237 drop target chose to perform an unspecified or unknown action.
  7238 
  7239 The source is also expected to cooperate with the target to perform
  7240 the action chosen by the target.  For example, callers should delete
  7241 the buffer text that was dragged if `XdndActionMove' is returned.
  7242 
  7243 There are also some other valid values of ACTION that depend on
  7244 details of both the drop target's implementation details and that of
  7245 Emacs.  For that reason, they are not mentioned here.  Consult
  7246 "Drag-and-Drop Protocol for the X Window System" for more details:
  7247 https://freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/XDND/.
  7248 
  7249 If RETURN-FRAME is non-nil, this function will return the frame if the
  7250 mouse pointer moves onto an Emacs frame, after first moving out of
  7251 FRAME.  (This is not guaranteed to work on some systems.)  If
  7252 RETURN-FRAME is the symbol `now', any frame underneath the mouse
  7253 pointer will be returned immediately.
  7254 
  7255 If ACTION is a list and not nil, its elements are assumed to be a cons
  7256 of (ITEM . STRING), where ITEM is the name of an action, and STRING is
  7257 a string describing ITEM to the user.  The drop target is expected to
  7258 prompt the user to choose between any of the actions in the list.
  7259 
  7260 If ACTION is not specified or nil, `XdndActionCopy' is used
  7261 instead.
  7262 
  7263 If ALLOW-CURRENT-FRAME is not specified or nil, then the drop target
  7264 is allowed to be FRAME.  Otherwise, no action will be taken if the
  7265 mouse buttons are released on top of FRAME.
  7266 
  7267 If FOLLOW-TOOLTIP is non-nil, any tooltip currently being displayed
  7268 will be moved to follow the mouse pointer while the drag is in
  7269 progress.  Note that this does not work with system tooltips (tooltips
  7270 created when `use-system-tooltips' is non-nil).
  7271 
  7272 This function will sometimes return immediately if no mouse buttons
  7273 are currently held down.  It should only be called when it is known
  7274 that mouse buttons are being held down, such as immediately after a
  7275 `down-mouse-1' (or similar) event.  */)
  7276   (Lisp_Object targets, Lisp_Object action, Lisp_Object frame,
  7277    Lisp_Object return_frame, Lisp_Object allow_current_frame,
  7278    Lisp_Object follow_tooltip)
  7279 {
  7280   struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  7281   int ntargets = 0, nnames = 0;
  7282   char *target_names[2048];
  7283   Atom *target_atoms;
  7284   Lisp_Object lval, original, targets_arg, tem, t1, t2;
  7285   Atom xaction;
  7286   Atom action_list[2048];
  7287   char *name_list[2048];
  7288 
  7289   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  7290 
  7291   CHECK_LIST (targets);
  7292   original = targets;
  7293   targets_arg = targets;
  7294 
  7295   FOR_EACH_TAIL (targets)
  7296     {
  7297       CHECK_STRING (XCAR (targets));
  7298 
  7299       if (ntargets < 2048)
  7300         {
  7301           SAFE_ALLOCA_STRING (target_names[ntargets],
  7302                               XCAR (targets));
  7303           ntargets++;
  7304         }
  7305       else
  7306         error ("Too many targets");
  7307     }
  7308 
  7309   CHECK_LIST_END (targets, original);
  7310 
  7311   if (NILP (action) || EQ (action, QXdndActionCopy))
  7312     xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionCopy;
  7313   else if (EQ (action, QXdndActionMove))
  7314     xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionMove;
  7315   else if (EQ (action, QXdndActionLink))
  7316     xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionLink;
  7317   else if (EQ (action, QXdndActionPrivate))
  7318     xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionPrivate;
  7319   else if (EQ (action, QXdndActionAsk))
  7320     xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionAsk;
  7321   else if (SYMBOLP (action))
  7322     /* This is to accommodate non-standard DND protocols such as XDS
  7323        that are explicitly implemented by Emacs, and is not documented
  7324        for that reason.  */
  7325     xaction = symbol_to_x_atom (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), action);
  7326   else if (CONSP (action))
  7327     {
  7328       xaction = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionAsk;
  7329       original = action;
  7330 
  7331       CHECK_LIST (action);
  7332       FOR_EACH_TAIL (action)
  7333         {
  7334           tem = XCAR (action);
  7335           CHECK_CONS (tem);
  7336           t1 = XCAR (tem);
  7337           t2 = XCDR (tem);
  7338           CHECK_SYMBOL (t1);
  7339           CHECK_STRING (t2);
  7340 
  7341           if (nnames < 2048)
  7342             {
  7343               if (EQ (t1, QXdndActionCopy))
  7344                 action_list[nnames] = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionCopy;
  7345               else if (EQ (t1, QXdndActionMove))
  7346                 action_list[nnames] = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionMove;
  7347               else if (EQ (t1, QXdndActionLink))
  7348                 action_list[nnames] = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionLink;
  7349               else if (EQ (t1, QXdndActionAsk))
  7350                 action_list[nnames] = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionAsk;
  7351               else if (EQ (t1, QXdndActionPrivate))
  7352                 action_list[nnames] = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionPrivate;
  7353               else
  7354                 signal_error ("Invalid drag-and-drop action", tem);
  7355 
  7356               SAFE_ALLOCA_STRING (name_list[nnames],
  7357                                   ENCODE_SYSTEM (t2));
  7358 
  7359               nnames++;
  7360             }
  7361           else
  7362             error ("Too many actions");
  7363         }
  7364       CHECK_LIST_END (action, original);
  7365     }
  7366   else
  7367     signal_error ("Invalid drag-and-drop action", action);
  7368 
  7369   target_atoms = SAFE_ALLOCA (ntargets * sizeof *target_atoms);
  7370 
  7371   /* Catch errors since interning lots of targets can potentially
  7372      generate a BadAlloc error.  */
  7373   x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
  7374   x_intern_atoms (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), target_names,
  7375                   ntargets, target_atoms);
  7376   x_check_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7377                   "Failed to intern target atoms: %s");
  7378   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
  7379 
  7380   lval = x_dnd_begin_drag_and_drop (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_user_time,
  7381                                     xaction, return_frame, action_list,
  7382                                     (const char **) &name_list, nnames,
  7383                                     !NILP (allow_current_frame), target_atoms,
  7384                                     ntargets, targets_arg, !NILP (follow_tooltip));
  7385 
  7386   SAFE_FREE ();
  7387   return lval;
  7388 }
  7389 
  7390 /************************************************************************
  7391                               X Displays
  7392  ************************************************************************/
  7393 
  7394 
  7395 /* Mapping visual names to visuals.  */
  7396 
  7397 static struct visual_class
  7398 {
  7399   const char *name;
  7400   int class;
  7401 }
  7402 visual_classes[] =
  7403 {
  7404   {"StaticGray",        StaticGray},
  7405   {"GrayScale",         GrayScale},
  7406   {"StaticColor",       StaticColor},
  7407   {"PseudoColor",       PseudoColor},
  7408   {"TrueColor",         TrueColor},
  7409   {"DirectColor",       DirectColor},
  7410   {NULL, 0}
  7411 };
  7412 
  7413 
  7414 #ifndef HAVE_XSCREENNUMBEROFSCREEN
  7415 
  7416 /* Value is the screen number of screen SCR.  This is a substitute for
  7417    the X function with the same name when that doesn't exist.  */
  7418 
  7419 int
  7420 XScreenNumberOfScreen (Screen *scr)
  7421 {
  7422   Display *dpy = scr->display;
  7423   int i;
  7424 
  7425   for (i = 0; i < dpy->nscreens; ++i)
  7426     if (scr == dpy->screens + i)
  7427       break;
  7428 
  7429   return i;
  7430 }
  7431 
  7432 #endif /* not HAVE_XSCREENNUMBEROFSCREEN */
  7433 
  7434 
  7435 /* Select the visual that should be used on display DPYINFO.  Set
  7436    members of DPYINFO appropriately.  Called from x_term_init.  */
  7437 
  7438 void
  7439 select_visual (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
  7440 {
  7441   Display *dpy = dpyinfo->display;
  7442   Screen *screen = dpyinfo->screen;
  7443 
  7444   /* See if a visual is specified.  */
  7445   AUTO_STRING (visualClass, "visualClass");
  7446   AUTO_STRING (VisualClass, "VisualClass");
  7447   Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo, visualClass,
  7448                                                 VisualClass, Qnil, Qnil);
  7449 
  7450   if (STRINGP (value))
  7451     {
  7452       /* VALUE should be of the form CLASS-DEPTH, where CLASS is one
  7453          of `PseudoColor', `TrueColor' etc. and DEPTH is the color
  7454          depth, a decimal number.  NAME is compared with case ignored.  */
  7455       char *s = alloca (SBYTES (value) + 1);
  7456       char *dash;
  7457       int i, class = -1;
  7458       XVisualInfo vinfo;
  7459 
  7460       lispstpcpy (s, value);
  7461       dash = strchr (s, '-');
  7462       if (dash)
  7463         {
  7464           dpyinfo->n_planes = atoi (dash + 1);
  7465           *dash = '\0';
  7466         }
  7467       else
  7468         /* We won't find a matching visual with depth 0, so that
  7469            an error will be printed below.  */
  7470         dpyinfo->n_planes = 0;
  7471 
  7472       /* Determine the visual class.  */
  7473       for (i = 0; visual_classes[i].name; ++i)
  7474         if (xstrcasecmp (s, visual_classes[i].name) == 0)
  7475           {
  7476             class = visual_classes[i].class;
  7477             break;
  7478           }
  7479 
  7480       /* Look up a matching visual for the specified class.  */
  7481       if (class == -1
  7482           || !XMatchVisualInfo (dpy, XScreenNumberOfScreen (screen),
  7483                                 dpyinfo->n_planes, class, &vinfo))
  7484         fatal ("Invalid visual specification '%s'",
  7485                SSDATA (ENCODE_SYSTEM (value)));
  7486 
  7487       dpyinfo->visual = vinfo.visual;
  7488       dpyinfo->visual_info = vinfo;
  7489     }
  7490   else
  7491     {
  7492       int n_visuals;
  7493       XVisualInfo *vinfo, vinfo_template;
  7494 
  7495       vinfo_template.screen = XScreenNumberOfScreen (screen);
  7496 
  7497 #if !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !(defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3) \
  7498   && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  7499       int i;
  7500       XRenderPictFormat *format;
  7501 
  7502       /* First attempt to find a visual with an alpha mask if
  7503          available.  That information is only available when the
  7504          render extension is present, and we cannot do much with such
  7505          a visual if it isn't.  */
  7506 
  7507       if (dpyinfo->xrender_supported_p)
  7508         {
  7509 
  7510           vinfo = XGetVisualInfo (dpy, VisualScreenMask,
  7511                                   &vinfo_template, &n_visuals);
  7512 
  7513           for (i = 0; i < n_visuals; ++i)
  7514             {
  7515               format = XRenderFindVisualFormat (dpy, vinfo[i].visual);
  7516 
  7517               if (format && format->type == PictTypeDirect
  7518                   && format->direct.alphaMask)
  7519                 {
  7520                   dpyinfo->n_planes = vinfo[i].depth;
  7521                   dpyinfo->visual = vinfo[i].visual;
  7522                   dpyinfo->visual_info = vinfo[i];
  7523                   dpyinfo->pict_format = format;
  7524 
  7525                   XFree (vinfo);
  7526                   return;
  7527                 }
  7528             }
  7529 
  7530           if (vinfo)
  7531             XFree (vinfo);
  7532         }
  7533 #endif /* !USE_X_TOOLKIT */
  7534 
  7535       /* Visual with alpha channel (or the Render extension) not
  7536          available, fallback to default visual.  */
  7537       dpyinfo->visual = DefaultVisualOfScreen (screen);
  7538       vinfo_template.visualid = XVisualIDFromVisual (dpyinfo->visual);
  7539       vinfo = XGetVisualInfo (dpy, VisualIDMask | VisualScreenMask,
  7540                               &vinfo_template, &n_visuals);
  7541       if (n_visuals <= 0)
  7542         fatal ("Can't get proper X visual info");
  7543       dpyinfo->visual_info = *vinfo;
  7544       dpyinfo->n_planes = vinfo->depth;
  7545       XFree (vinfo);
  7546     }
  7547 }
  7548 
  7549 
  7550 /* Return the X display structure for the display named NAME.
  7551    Open a new connection if necessary.  */
  7552 
  7553 static struct x_display_info *
  7554 x_display_info_for_name (Lisp_Object name)
  7555 {
  7556   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  7557 
  7558   CHECK_STRING (name);
  7559 
  7560   for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo; dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
  7561     if (!NILP (Fstring_equal (XCAR (dpyinfo->name_list_element), name)))
  7562       return dpyinfo;
  7563 
  7564   /* Use this general default value to start with.  */
  7565   Vx_resource_name = Vinvocation_name;
  7566 
  7567   validate_x_resource_name ();
  7568 
  7569   dpyinfo = x_term_init (name, 0, SSDATA (Vx_resource_name));
  7570 
  7571   if (dpyinfo == 0)
  7572     error ("Cannot connect to X server %s", SDATA (name));
  7573 
  7574   return dpyinfo;
  7575 }
  7576 
  7577 
  7578 DEFUN ("x-open-connection", Fx_open_connection, Sx_open_connection,
  7579        1, 3, 0,
  7580        doc: /* Open a connection to a display server.
  7581 DISPLAY is the name of the display to connect to.
  7582 Optional second arg XRM-STRING is a string of resources in xrdb format.
  7583 If the optional third arg MUST-SUCCEED is non-nil,
  7584 terminate Emacs if we can't open the connection.
  7585 \(In the Nextstep version, the last two arguments are currently ignored.)  */)
  7586   (Lisp_Object display, Lisp_Object xrm_string, Lisp_Object must_succeed)
  7587 {
  7588   char *xrm_option;
  7589   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  7590 
  7591   CHECK_STRING (display);
  7592   if (! NILP (xrm_string))
  7593     CHECK_STRING (xrm_string);
  7594 
  7595   xrm_option = NILP (xrm_string) ? 0 : SSDATA (xrm_string);
  7596 
  7597   validate_x_resource_name ();
  7598 
  7599   /* This is what opens the connection and sets x_current_display.
  7600      This also initializes many symbols, such as those used for input.  */
  7601   dpyinfo = x_term_init (display, xrm_option,
  7602                          SSDATA (Vx_resource_name));
  7603 
  7604   if (dpyinfo == 0)
  7605     {
  7606       if (!NILP (must_succeed))
  7607         fatal ("Cannot connect to X server %s.\n\
  7608 Check the DISPLAY environment variable or use `-d'.\n\
  7609 Also use the `xauth' program to verify that you have the proper\n\
  7610 authorization information needed to connect the X server.\n\
  7611 An insecure way to solve the problem may be to use `xhost'.\n",
  7612                SDATA (display));
  7613       else
  7614         error ("Cannot connect to X server %s", SDATA (display));
  7615     }
  7616 
  7617   return Qnil;
  7618 }
  7619 
  7620 DEFUN ("x-close-connection", Fx_close_connection,
  7621        Sx_close_connection, 1, 1, 0,
  7622        doc: /* Close the connection to TERMINAL's X server.
  7623 For TERMINAL, specify a terminal object, a frame or a display name (a
  7624 string).  If TERMINAL is nil, that stands for the selected frame's terminal.
  7625 \(On MS Windows, this function does not accept terminal objects.)  */)
  7626   (Lisp_Object terminal)
  7627 {
  7628   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
  7629 
  7630   if (dpyinfo->reference_count > 0)
  7631     error ("Display still has frames on it");
  7632 
  7633   x_delete_terminal (dpyinfo->terminal);
  7634 
  7635   return Qnil;
  7636 }
  7637 
  7638 DEFUN ("x-display-list", Fx_display_list, Sx_display_list, 0, 0, 0,
  7639        doc: /* Return the list of display names that Emacs has connections to.  */)
  7640   (void)
  7641 {
  7642   Lisp_Object result = Qnil;
  7643   struct x_display_info *xdi;
  7644 
  7645   for (xdi = x_display_list; xdi; xdi = xdi->next)
  7646     result = Fcons (XCAR (xdi->name_list_element), result);
  7647 
  7648   return result;
  7649 }
  7650 
  7651 DEFUN ("x-synchronize", Fx_synchronize, Sx_synchronize, 1, 2, 0,
  7652        doc: /* If ON is non-nil, report X errors as soon as the erring request is made.
  7653 This function has an effect only on X Windows.  With MS Windows, it is
  7654 defined but does nothing.
  7655 
  7656 If ON is nil, allow buffering of requests.
  7657 Turning on synchronization prohibits the Xlib routines from buffering
  7658 requests and seriously degrades performance, but makes debugging much
  7659 easier.
  7660 The optional second argument TERMINAL specifies which display to act on.
  7661 TERMINAL should be a terminal object, a frame or a display name (a string).
  7662 If TERMINAL is omitted or nil, that stands for the selected frame's display.  */)
  7663   (Lisp_Object on, Lisp_Object terminal)
  7664 {
  7665   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
  7666 
  7667   XSynchronize (dpyinfo->display, !NILP (on));
  7668 
  7669   return Qnil;
  7670 }
  7671 
  7672 
  7673 /***********************************************************************
  7674                            Window properties
  7675  ***********************************************************************/
  7676 
  7677 DEFUN ("x-change-window-property", Fx_change_window_property,
  7678        Sx_change_window_property, 2, 7, 0,
  7679        doc: /* Change window property PROP to VALUE on the X window of FRAME.
  7680 PROP must be a string.  VALUE may be a string or a list of conses,
  7681 numbers and/or strings.  If an element in the list is a string, it is
  7682 converted to an atom and the value of the atom is used.  If an element
  7683 is a cons, it is converted to a 32 bit number where the car is the 16
  7684 top bits and the cdr is the lower 16 bits.
  7685 
  7686 FRAME nil or omitted means use the selected frame.  If TYPE is given
  7687 and non-nil, it is the name of the type of VALUE.  If TYPE is not
  7688 given or nil, the type is STRING.
  7689 
  7690 FORMAT gives the size in bits of each element if VALUE is a list.  It
  7691 must be one of 8, 16 or 32.
  7692 
  7693 If VALUE is a string or FORMAT is nil or not given, FORMAT defaults to
  7694 8.  If OUTER-P is non-nil, the property is changed for the outer X
  7695 window of FRAME.  Default is to change on the edit X window.
  7696 
  7697 If WINDOW-ID is non-nil, change the property of that window instead of
  7698 FRAME's X window; the number 0 denotes the root window.  This argument
  7699 is separate from FRAME because window IDs are not unique across X
  7700 displays or screens on the same display, so FRAME provides context for
  7701 the window ID.
  7702 
  7703 If VALUE is a string and FORMAT is 32, then the format of VALUE is
  7704 system-specific.  VALUE must contain unsigned integer data in native
  7705 endian-ness in multiples of the size of the C type 'long': the low 32
  7706 bits of each such number are used as the value of each element of the
  7707 property.
  7708 
  7709 Wait for the request to complete and signal any error, unless
  7710 `x-fast-protocol-requests' is non-nil, in which case errors will be
  7711 silently ignored.  */)
  7712   (Lisp_Object prop, Lisp_Object value, Lisp_Object frame,
  7713    Lisp_Object type, Lisp_Object format, Lisp_Object outer_p,
  7714    Lisp_Object window_id)
  7715 {
  7716   struct frame *f;
  7717   Atom prop_atom;
  7718   Atom target_type = XA_STRING;
  7719   int element_format = 8;
  7720   unsigned char *data;
  7721   int nelements;
  7722   Window target_window;
  7723   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  7724 #ifdef USE_XCB
  7725   bool intern_prop;
  7726   bool intern_target;
  7727   xcb_intern_atom_cookie_t prop_atom_cookie;
  7728   xcb_intern_atom_cookie_t target_type_cookie;
  7729   xcb_intern_atom_reply_t *reply;
  7730   xcb_generic_error_t *generic_error;
  7731   bool rc;
  7732 #endif
  7733 
  7734   f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  7735   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  7736 
  7737   CHECK_STRING (prop);
  7738 
  7739   if (! NILP (format))
  7740     {
  7741       CHECK_FIXNUM (format);
  7742 
  7743       if (XFIXNUM (format) != 8 && XFIXNUM (format) != 16
  7744           && XFIXNUM (format) != 32)
  7745         error ("FORMAT must be one of 8, 16 or 32");
  7746       element_format = XFIXNUM (format);
  7747     }
  7748 
  7749   if (CONSP (value))
  7750     {
  7751       ptrdiff_t elsize;
  7752 
  7753       nelements = x_check_property_data (value);
  7754       if (nelements == -1)
  7755         error ("Bad data in VALUE, must be number, string or cons");
  7756 
  7757       /* The man page for XChangeProperty:
  7758              "If the specified format is 32, the property data must be a
  7759               long array."
  7760          This applies even if long is more than 32 bits.  The X library
  7761          converts to 32 bits before sending to the X server.  */
  7762       elsize = element_format == 32 ? sizeof (long) : element_format >> 3;
  7763       data = xnmalloc (nelements, elsize);
  7764 
  7765       x_fill_property_data (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), value, data, nelements,
  7766                             element_format);
  7767     }
  7768   else
  7769     {
  7770       ptrdiff_t elsize;
  7771 
  7772       CHECK_STRING (value);
  7773       data = SDATA (value);
  7774       if (INT_MAX < SBYTES (value))
  7775         error ("VALUE too long");
  7776 
  7777       /* See comment above about longs and format=32 */
  7778       elsize = element_format == 32 ? sizeof (long) : element_format >> 3;
  7779       if (SBYTES (value) % elsize != 0)
  7780         error ("VALUE must contain an integral number of octets for FORMAT");
  7781       nelements = SBYTES (value) / elsize;
  7782     }
  7783 
  7784   if (! NILP (window_id))
  7785     {
  7786       CONS_TO_INTEGER (window_id, Window, target_window);
  7787       if (! target_window)
  7788         target_window = dpyinfo->root_window;
  7789     }
  7790   else
  7791     {
  7792       if (! NILP (outer_p))
  7793         target_window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
  7794       else
  7795         target_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
  7796     }
  7797 
  7798   block_input ();
  7799 #ifndef USE_XCB
  7800   prop_atom = x_intern_cached_atom (dpyinfo, SSDATA (prop),
  7801                                     false);
  7802   if (! NILP (type))
  7803     {
  7804       CHECK_STRING (type);
  7805       target_type = x_intern_cached_atom (dpyinfo, SSDATA (type),
  7806                                           false);
  7807     }
  7808 #else
  7809   rc = true;
  7810   intern_target = true;
  7811   intern_prop = true;
  7812 
  7813   prop_atom = x_intern_cached_atom (dpyinfo, SSDATA (prop),
  7814                                     true);
  7815 
  7816   if (prop_atom != None)
  7817     intern_prop = false;
  7818   else
  7819     prop_atom_cookie
  7820       = xcb_intern_atom (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  7821                          0, SBYTES (prop), SSDATA (prop));
  7822 
  7823   if (!NILP (type))
  7824     {
  7825       CHECK_STRING (type);
  7826 
  7827       target_type = x_intern_cached_atom (dpyinfo, SSDATA (type),
  7828                                           true);
  7829 
  7830       if (target_type)
  7831         intern_target = false;
  7832       else
  7833         target_type_cookie
  7834           = xcb_intern_atom (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  7835                              0, SBYTES (type), SSDATA (type));
  7836     }
  7837 
  7838   if (intern_prop)
  7839     {
  7840       reply = xcb_intern_atom_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  7841                                      prop_atom_cookie, &generic_error);
  7842 
  7843       if (reply)
  7844         {
  7845           prop_atom = (Atom) reply->atom;
  7846           free (reply);
  7847         }
  7848       else
  7849         {
  7850           free (generic_error);
  7851           rc = false;
  7852         }
  7853     }
  7854 
  7855   if (!NILP (type) && intern_target)
  7856     {
  7857       reply = xcb_intern_atom_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  7858                                      target_type_cookie, &generic_error);
  7859 
  7860       if (reply)
  7861         {
  7862           target_type = (Atom) reply->atom;
  7863           free (reply);
  7864         }
  7865       else
  7866         {
  7867           free (generic_error);
  7868           rc = false;
  7869         }
  7870     }
  7871 
  7872   if (!rc)
  7873     error ("Failed to intern type or property atom");
  7874 #endif
  7875 
  7876   x_catch_errors_for_lisp (dpyinfo);
  7877 
  7878   XChangeProperty (dpyinfo->display, target_window,
  7879                    prop_atom, target_type, element_format,
  7880                    PropModeReplace, data, nelements);
  7881 
  7882   if (CONSP (value))
  7883     xfree (data);
  7884 
  7885   x_check_errors_for_lisp (dpyinfo,
  7886                            "Couldn't change window property: %s");
  7887   x_uncatch_errors_for_lisp (dpyinfo);
  7888 
  7889   unblock_input ();
  7890   return value;
  7891 }
  7892 
  7893 
  7894 DEFUN ("x-delete-window-property", Fx_delete_window_property,
  7895        Sx_delete_window_property, 1, 3, 0,
  7896        doc: /* Remove window property PROP from X window of FRAME.
  7897 FRAME nil or omitted means use the selected frame.
  7898 If WINDOW-ID is non-nil, remove property from that window instead
  7899  of FRAME's X window; the number 0 denotes the root window.  This
  7900  argument is separate from FRAME because window IDs are not unique
  7901  across X displays or screens on the same display, so FRAME provides
  7902  context for the window ID.
  7903 
  7904 Value is PROP.
  7905 
  7906 Wait for the request to complete and signal any error, unless
  7907 `x-fast-protocol-requests' is non-nil, in which case errors will be
  7908 silently ignored.  */)
  7909   (Lisp_Object prop, Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object window_id)
  7910 {
  7911   struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  7912   Window target_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
  7913   Atom prop_atom;
  7914 
  7915   CHECK_STRING (prop);
  7916 
  7917   if (! NILP (window_id))
  7918     {
  7919       CONS_TO_INTEGER (window_id, Window, target_window);
  7920       if (! target_window)
  7921         target_window = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window;
  7922     }
  7923 
  7924   block_input ();
  7925   prop_atom = x_intern_cached_atom (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  7926                                     SSDATA (prop), false);
  7927 
  7928   x_catch_errors_for_lisp (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  7929   XDeleteProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), target_window, prop_atom);
  7930   x_check_errors_for_lisp (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  7931                            "Couldn't delete window property: %s");
  7932   x_uncatch_errors_for_lisp (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  7933 
  7934   unblock_input ();
  7935   return prop;
  7936 }
  7937 
  7938 
  7939 static Lisp_Object
  7940 x_window_property_intern (struct frame *f,
  7941                           Window target_window,
  7942                           Atom prop_atom,
  7943                           Atom target_type,
  7944                           Lisp_Object delete_p,
  7945                           Lisp_Object vector_ret_p,
  7946                           bool *found)
  7947 {
  7948   unsigned char *tmp_data = NULL;
  7949   Lisp_Object prop_value = Qnil;
  7950   Atom actual_type;
  7951   int actual_format;
  7952   unsigned long actual_size, bytes_remaining;
  7953   int rc;
  7954 
  7955   rc = XGetWindowProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), target_window,
  7956                            prop_atom, 0, 0, False, target_type,
  7957                            &actual_type, &actual_format, &actual_size,
  7958                            &bytes_remaining, &tmp_data);
  7959 
  7960   *found = actual_format != 0;
  7961 
  7962   if (rc == Success && *found)
  7963     {
  7964       XFree (tmp_data);
  7965       tmp_data = NULL;
  7966 
  7967       rc = XGetWindowProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), target_window,
  7968                                prop_atom, 0, bytes_remaining,
  7969                                ! NILP (delete_p), target_type,
  7970                                &actual_type, &actual_format,
  7971                                &actual_size, &bytes_remaining,
  7972                                &tmp_data);
  7973       if (rc == Success && tmp_data)
  7974         {
  7975           /* The man page for XGetWindowProperty says:
  7976              "If the returned format is 32, the returned data is represented
  7977              as a long array and should be cast to that type to obtain the
  7978              elements."
  7979              This applies even if long is more than 32 bits, the X library
  7980              converts from 32 bit elements received from the X server to long
  7981              and passes the long array to us.  Thus, for that case memcpy can not
  7982              be used.  We convert to a 32 bit type here, because so much code
  7983              assume on that.
  7984 
  7985              The bytes and offsets passed to XGetWindowProperty refers to the
  7986              property and those are indeed in 32 bit quantities if format is
  7987              32.  */
  7988 
  7989           if (LONG_WIDTH > 32 && actual_format == 32)
  7990             {
  7991               unsigned long i;
  7992               int  *idata = (int *) tmp_data;
  7993               long *ldata = (long *) tmp_data;
  7994 
  7995               for (i = 0; i < actual_size; ++i)
  7996                 idata[i] = (int) ldata[i];
  7997             }
  7998 
  7999           if (NILP (vector_ret_p))
  8000             prop_value = make_string ((char *) tmp_data,
  8001                                       (actual_format >> 3) * actual_size);
  8002           else
  8003             prop_value = x_property_data_to_lisp (f,
  8004                                                   tmp_data,
  8005                                                   actual_type,
  8006                                                   actual_format,
  8007                                                   actual_size);
  8008         }
  8009 
  8010       if (tmp_data) XFree (tmp_data);
  8011     }
  8012 
  8013   return prop_value;
  8014 }
  8015 
  8016 DEFUN ("x-window-property", Fx_window_property, Sx_window_property,
  8017        1, 6, 0,
  8018        doc: /* Value is the value of window property PROP on FRAME.
  8019 If FRAME is nil or omitted, use the selected frame.
  8020 
  8021 On X Windows, the following optional arguments are also accepted: If
  8022 TYPE is nil or omitted, get the property as a string.  Otherwise TYPE
  8023 is the name of the atom that denotes the expected type.
  8024 
  8025 If TYPE is the string "AnyPropertyType", decode and return the data
  8026 regardless of what the type really is.
  8027 
  8028 The format of the data returned is the same as a selection conversion
  8029 to the given type.  For example, if `x-get-selection-internal' returns
  8030 an integer when the selection data is a given type,
  8031 `x-window-property' will do the same for that type.
  8032 
  8033 If WINDOW-ID is non-nil, get the property of that window instead of
  8034 FRAME's X window; the number 0 denotes the root window.  This argument
  8035 is separate from FRAME because window IDs are not unique across X
  8036 displays, so FRAME provides context for the window ID.
  8037 
  8038 If DELETE-P is non-nil, delete the property after retrieving it.
  8039 If VECTOR-RET-P is non-nil, return a vector of values instead of a string.
  8040 
  8041 X allows an arbitrary number of properties to be set on any window.
  8042 However, properties are most often set by the window manager or other
  8043 programs on the root window or FRAME's X window in order to
  8044 communicate information to Emacs and other programs.  Most of these
  8045 properties are specified as part of the Extended Window Manager Hints
  8046 and the Inter-Client Communication Conventions Manual, which are
  8047 located here:
  8048 
  8049   https://specifications.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/wm-spec-latest.html
  8050 
  8051 and
  8052 
  8053   https://x.org/releases/X11R7.6/doc/xorg-docs/specs/ICCCM/icccm.html
  8054 
  8055 Return value is nil if FRAME doesn't have a property with name PROP or
  8056 if PROP has no value of TYPE (always a string in the MS Windows case). */)
  8057   (Lisp_Object prop, Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object type,
  8058    Lisp_Object window_id, Lisp_Object delete_p, Lisp_Object vector_ret_p)
  8059 {
  8060   struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  8061   Atom prop_atom;
  8062   Lisp_Object prop_value = Qnil;
  8063   Atom target_type = XA_STRING;
  8064   Window target_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
  8065   bool found;
  8066 
  8067   CHECK_STRING (prop);
  8068 
  8069   if (! NILP (window_id))
  8070     {
  8071       CONS_TO_INTEGER (window_id, Window, target_window);
  8072       if (! target_window)
  8073         target_window = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window;
  8074     }
  8075 
  8076   block_input ();
  8077   x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
  8078 
  8079   if (STRINGP (type))
  8080     {
  8081       if (strcmp ("AnyPropertyType", SSDATA (type)) == 0)
  8082         target_type = AnyPropertyType;
  8083       else
  8084         target_type = x_intern_cached_atom (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  8085                                             SSDATA (type), false);
  8086     }
  8087 
  8088   prop_atom = x_intern_cached_atom (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  8089                                     SSDATA (prop), false);
  8090   prop_value = x_window_property_intern (f,
  8091                                          target_window,
  8092                                          prop_atom,
  8093                                          target_type,
  8094                                          delete_p,
  8095                                          vector_ret_p,
  8096                                          &found);
  8097   if (NILP (prop_value)
  8098       && ! found
  8099       && NILP (window_id)
  8100       && target_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  8101     {
  8102       prop_value = x_window_property_intern (f,
  8103                                              FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8104                                              prop_atom,
  8105                                              target_type,
  8106                                              delete_p,
  8107                                              vector_ret_p,
  8108                                              &found);
  8109     }
  8110 
  8111   x_check_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  8112                   "Can't retrieve window property: %s");
  8113   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
  8114 
  8115   unblock_input ();
  8116   return prop_value;
  8117 }
  8118 
  8119 DEFUN ("x-window-property-attributes", Fx_window_property_attributes, Sx_window_property_attributes,
  8120        1, 3, 0,
  8121        doc: /* Retrieve metadata about window property PROP on FRAME.
  8122 If FRAME is nil or omitted, use the selected frame.
  8123 If WINDOW-ID is non-nil, get the property of that window instead of
  8124  FRAME's X window; the number 0 denotes the root window.  This
  8125  argument is separate from FRAME because window IDs are not unique
  8126  across X displays or screens on the same display, so FRAME provides
  8127  context for the window ID.
  8128 
  8129 Return value is nil if FRAME doesn't have a property named PROP.
  8130 Otherwise, the return value is a vector with the following fields:
  8131 
  8132 0. The property type, as an integer.  The symbolic name of
  8133  the type can be obtained with `x-get-atom-name'.
  8134 1. The format of each element; one of 8, 16, or 32.
  8135 2. The length of the property, in number of elements. */)
  8136   (Lisp_Object prop, Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object window_id)
  8137 {
  8138   struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  8139   Window target_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
  8140   Atom prop_atom;
  8141   Lisp_Object prop_attr = Qnil;
  8142   Atom actual_type;
  8143   int actual_format;
  8144   unsigned long actual_size, bytes_remaining;
  8145   unsigned char *tmp_data = NULL;
  8146   int rc;
  8147 
  8148   CHECK_STRING (prop);
  8149 
  8150   if (! NILP (window_id))
  8151     {
  8152       CONS_TO_INTEGER (window_id, Window, target_window);
  8153       if (! target_window)
  8154         target_window = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window;
  8155     }
  8156 
  8157   block_input ();
  8158 
  8159   x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
  8160   prop_atom = x_intern_cached_atom (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  8161                                     SSDATA (prop), false);
  8162   rc = XGetWindowProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), target_window,
  8163                            prop_atom, 0, 0, False, AnyPropertyType,
  8164                            &actual_type, &actual_format, &actual_size,
  8165                            &bytes_remaining, &tmp_data);
  8166   if (rc == Success          /* no invalid params */
  8167       && actual_format == 0  /* but prop not found */
  8168       && NILP (window_id)
  8169       && target_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  8170     {
  8171       /* analogous behavior to x-window-property: if property isn't found
  8172          on the frame's inner window and no alternate window id was
  8173          provided, try the frame's outer window. */
  8174       target_window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
  8175       rc = XGetWindowProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), target_window,
  8176                                prop_atom, 0, 0, False, AnyPropertyType,
  8177                                &actual_type, &actual_format, &actual_size,
  8178                                &bytes_remaining, &tmp_data);
  8179     }
  8180 
  8181   if (rc == Success && actual_format != 0)
  8182     {
  8183       XFree (tmp_data);
  8184 
  8185       prop_attr = CALLN (Fvector,
  8186                          make_fixnum (actual_type),
  8187                          make_fixnum (actual_format),
  8188                          make_fixnum (bytes_remaining / (actual_format >> 3)));
  8189     }
  8190 
  8191   x_check_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  8192                   "Can't retrieve window property: %s");
  8193   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
  8194 
  8195   unblock_input ();
  8196   return prop_attr;
  8197 }
  8198 
  8199 
  8200 /***********************************************************************
  8201                            Coordinate management
  8202  ***********************************************************************/
  8203 
  8204 DEFUN ("x-translate-coordinates", Fx_translate_coordinates,
  8205        Sx_translate_coordinates,
  8206        1, 6, 0, doc: /* Translate coordinates from FRAME.
  8207 Translate the given coordinates SOURCE-X and SOURCE-Y from
  8208 SOURCE-WINDOW's coordinate space to that of DEST-WINDOW, on FRAME.
  8209 
  8210 If SOURCE-X and SOURCE-Y are nil, use 0 instead.
  8211 
  8212 FRAME can either be a terminal or a frame.  If nil, it defaults to the
  8213 selected frame.  SOURCE-WINDOW must be an X window ID, 0 (which means
  8214 to use the root window), or nil, which means to use FRAME's inner
  8215 window.  DEST-WINDOW must be another X window ID, or nil (which means
  8216 to use the root window).
  8217 
  8218 Return a list of (X Y CHILD) if the given coordinates are on the same
  8219 screen, or nil otherwise, where X and Y are the coordinates in
  8220 DEST-WINDOW's coordinate space, and CHILD is the window ID of any
