  8221 mapped child in DEST-WINDOW at those coordinates, or nil if there is
  8222 no such window.  If REQUIRE-CHILD is nil, avoid fetching CHILD if it
  8223 would result in an avoidable request to the X server, thereby
  8224 improving performance when the X connection is over a slow network.
  8225 Otherwise, always obtain the mapped child window from the X
  8226 server.  */)
  8227   (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object source_window,
  8228    Lisp_Object dest_window, Lisp_Object source_x,
  8229    Lisp_Object source_y, Lisp_Object require_child)
  8230 {
  8231   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  8232   struct frame *source_frame;
  8233   int dest_x, dest_y;
  8234   Window child_return, src, dest;
  8235   Bool rc;
  8236   Lisp_Object temp_result;
  8237 
  8238   dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (frame);
  8239   dest_x = 0;
  8240   dest_y = 0;
  8241 
  8242   if (!NILP (source_x))
  8243     {
  8244       CHECK_FIXNUM (source_x);
  8245       dest_x = XFIXNUM (source_x);
  8246     }
  8247 
  8248   if (!NILP (source_y))
  8249     {
  8250       CHECK_FIXNUM (source_y);
  8251       dest_y = XFIXNUM (source_y);
  8252     }
  8253 
  8254   source_frame = NULL;
  8255 
  8256   if (!NILP (source_window))
  8257     CONS_TO_INTEGER (source_window, Window, src);
  8258   else
  8259     {
  8260       source_frame = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  8261       src = FRAME_X_WINDOW (source_frame);
  8262     }
  8263 
  8264   /* If require_child is nil, try to avoid an avoidable roundtrip to
  8265      the X server.  */
  8266   if (NILP (require_child) && source_frame)
  8267     {
  8268       temp_result
  8269         = x_handle_translate_coordinates (source_frame, dest_window, dest_x,
  8270                                           dest_y);
  8271       if (!NILP (temp_result))
  8272         return temp_result;
  8273     }
  8274 
  8275   if (!src)
  8276     src = dpyinfo->root_window;
  8277 
  8278   if (!NILP (dest_window))
  8279     CONS_TO_INTEGER (dest_window, Window, dest);
  8280   else
  8281     dest = dpyinfo->root_window;
  8282 
  8283   block_input ();
  8284   x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
  8285   rc = XTranslateCoordinates (dpyinfo->display, src, dest,
  8286                               dest_x, dest_y, &dest_x, &dest_y,
  8287                               &child_return);
  8288   x_check_errors (dpyinfo->display,
  8289                   "Couldn't translate coordinates: %s");
  8290   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
  8291   unblock_input ();
  8292 
  8293   if (!rc)
  8294     return Qnil;
  8295 
  8296   return list3 (make_int (dest_x),
  8297                 make_int (dest_y),
  8298                 (child_return != None
  8299                  ? make_uint (child_return)
  8300                  : Qnil));
  8301 }
  8302 
  8303 /***********************************************************************
  8304                                 Tool tips
  8305  ***********************************************************************/
  8306 
  8307 static void compute_tip_xy (struct frame *, Lisp_Object, Lisp_Object,
  8308                             Lisp_Object, int, int, int *, int *);
  8309 
  8310 /* The frame of the currently visible tooltip, or nil if none.  */
  8311 Lisp_Object tip_frame;
  8312 
  8313 /* The window-system window corresponding to the frame of the
  8314    currently visible tooltip.  */
  8315 Window tip_window;
  8316 
  8317 /* The X and Y deltas of the last call to `x-show-tip'.  */
  8318 Lisp_Object tip_dx, tip_dy;
  8319 
  8320 /* A timer that hides or deletes the currently visible tooltip when it
  8321    fires.  */
  8322 static Lisp_Object tip_timer;
  8323 
  8324 /* STRING argument of last `x-show-tip' call.  */
  8325 static Lisp_Object tip_last_string;
  8326 
  8327 /* Normalized FRAME argument of last `x-show-tip' call.  */
  8328 static Lisp_Object tip_last_frame;
  8329 
  8330 /* PARMS argument of last `x-show-tip' call.  */
  8331 static Lisp_Object tip_last_parms;
  8332 
  8333 
  8334 static void
  8335 unwind_create_tip_frame (Lisp_Object frame)
  8336 {
  8337   Lisp_Object deleted;
  8338 
  8339   deleted = unwind_create_frame (frame);
  8340   if (EQ (deleted, Qt))
  8341     {
  8342       tip_window = None;
  8343       tip_frame = Qnil;
  8344     }
  8345 }
  8346 
  8347 
  8348 /* Create a frame for a tooltip on the display described by DPYINFO.
  8349    PARMS is a list of frame parameters.  TEXT is the string to
  8350    display in the tip frame.  Value is the frame.
  8351 
  8352    Note that functions called here, esp. gui_default_parameter can
  8353    signal errors, for instance when a specified color name is
  8354    undefined.  We have to make sure that we're in a consistent state
  8355    when this happens.  */
  8356 
  8357 static Lisp_Object
  8358 x_create_tip_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Lisp_Object parms)
  8359 {
  8360   struct frame *f;
  8361   Lisp_Object frame;
  8362   Lisp_Object name;
  8363   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8364   bool face_change_before = face_change;
  8365 
  8366   if (!dpyinfo->terminal->name)
  8367     error ("Terminal is not live, can't create new frames on it");
  8368 
  8369   parms = Fcopy_alist (parms);
  8370 
  8371   /* Get the name of the frame to use for resource lookup.  */
  8372   name = gui_display_get_arg (dpyinfo, parms, Qname, "name", "Name",
  8373                               RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8374   if (!STRINGP (name)
  8375       && !BASE_EQ (name, Qunbound)
  8376       && !NILP (name))
  8377     error ("Invalid frame name--not a string or nil");
  8378 
  8379   frame = Qnil;
  8380   f = make_frame (false);
  8381   f->wants_modeline = false;
  8382   XSETFRAME (frame, f);
  8383   record_unwind_protect (unwind_create_tip_frame, frame);
  8384 
  8385   f->terminal = dpyinfo->terminal;
  8386 
  8387   /* By setting the output method, we're essentially saying that
  8388      the frame is live, as per FRAME_LIVE_P.  If we get a signal
  8389      from this point on, x_destroy_window might screw up reference
  8390      counts etc.  */
  8391   f->output_method = output_x_window;
  8392   f->output_data.x = xzalloc (sizeof *f->output_data.x);
  8393   f->output_data.x->icon_bitmap = -1;
  8394   FRAME_FONTSET (f) = -1;
  8395   f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel = -1;
  8396   f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel = -1;
  8397 #if defined (USE_LUCID) && defined (USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS)
  8398   f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel = -1;
  8399   f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel = -1;
  8400 #endif /* USE_LUCID && USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
  8401   f->output_data.x->white_relief.pixel = -1;
  8402   f->output_data.x->black_relief.pixel = -1;
  8403 
  8404   f->tooltip = true;
  8405   fset_icon_name (f, Qnil);
  8406   FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) = dpyinfo;
  8407   f->output_data.x->parent_desc = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window;
  8408   f->output_data.x->explicit_parent = false;
  8409 
  8410   /* These colors will be set anyway later, but it's important
  8411      to get the color reference counts right, so initialize them!  */
  8412   {
  8413     Lisp_Object black;
  8414 
  8415     /* Function x_decode_color can signal an error.  Make
  8416        sure to initialize color slots so that we won't try
  8417        to free colors we haven't allocated.  */
  8418     FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f) = -1;
  8419     FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f) = -1;
  8420     f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel = -1;
  8421     f->output_data.x->cursor_foreground_pixel = -1;
  8422     f->output_data.x->border_pixel = -1;
  8423     f->output_data.x->mouse_pixel = -1;
  8424 
  8425     black = build_string ("black");
  8426     FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f)
  8427       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8428     FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f)
  8429       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8430     f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel
  8431       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8432     f->output_data.x->cursor_foreground_pixel
  8433       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8434     f->output_data.x->border_pixel
  8435       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8436     f->output_data.x->mouse_pixel
  8437       = x_decode_color (f, black, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  8438   }
  8439 
  8440   /* Set the name; the functions to which we pass f expect the name to
  8441      be set.  */
  8442   if (BASE_EQ (name, Qunbound) || NILP (name))
  8443     {
  8444       fset_name (f, build_string (dpyinfo->x_id_name));
  8445       f->explicit_name = false;
  8446     }
  8447   else
  8448     {
  8449       fset_name (f, name);
  8450       f->explicit_name = true;
  8451       /* use the frame's title when getting resources for this frame.  */
  8452       specbind (Qx_resource_name, name);
  8453     }
  8454 
  8455 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  8456   register_font_driver (&ftcrfont_driver, f);
  8457 #ifdef HAVE_HARFBUZZ
  8458   register_font_driver (&ftcrhbfont_driver, f);
  8459 #endif  /* HAVE_HARFBUZZ */
  8460 #else
  8461 #ifdef HAVE_FREETYPE
  8462 #ifdef HAVE_XFT
  8463   register_font_driver (&xftfont_driver, f);
  8464 #ifdef HAVE_HARFBUZZ
  8465   register_font_driver (&xfthbfont_driver, f);
  8466 #endif
  8467 #endif  /* not HAVE_XFT */
  8468 #endif  /* HAVE_FREETYPE */
  8469 #endif  /* not USE_CAIRO */
  8470   register_font_driver (&xfont_driver, f);
  8471 
  8472   image_cache_refcount =
  8473     FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f) ? FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f)->refcount : 0;
  8474 #ifdef GLYPH_DEBUG
  8475   dpyinfo_refcount = dpyinfo->reference_count;
  8476 #endif /* GLYPH_DEBUG */
  8477 
  8478   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qfont_backend, Qnil,
  8479                          "fontBackend", "FontBackend", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8480 
  8481   /* Extract the window parameters from the supplied values that are
  8482      needed to determine window geometry.  */
  8483   x_default_font_parameter (f, parms);
  8484 
  8485   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qborder_width, make_fixnum (0),
  8486                          "borderWidth", "BorderWidth", RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8487 
  8488   /* This defaults to 1 in order to match xterm.  We recognize either
  8489      internalBorderWidth or internalBorder (which is what xterm calls
  8490      it).  */
  8491   if (NILP (Fassq (Qinternal_border_width, parms)))
  8492     {
  8493       Lisp_Object value;
  8494 
  8495       value = gui_display_get_arg (dpyinfo, parms, Qinternal_border_width,
  8496                                    "internalBorder", "internalBorder",
  8497                                    RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8498       if (! BASE_EQ (value, Qunbound))
  8499         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qinternal_border_width, value),
  8500                        parms);
  8501     }
  8502 
  8503   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qinternal_border_width, make_fixnum (1),
  8504                          "internalBorderWidth", "internalBorderWidth",
  8505                          RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8506   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qright_divider_width, make_fixnum (0),
  8507                          NULL, NULL, RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8508   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qbottom_divider_width, make_fixnum (0),
  8509                          NULL, NULL, RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8510 
  8511   /* Also do the stuff which must be set before the window exists.  */
  8512   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qforeground_color, build_string ("black"),
  8513                          "foreground", "Foreground", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8514   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qbackground_color, build_string ("white"),
  8515                          "background", "Background", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8516   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qmouse_color, build_string ("black"),
  8517                          "pointerColor", "Foreground", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8518   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qcursor_color, build_string ("black"),
  8519                          "cursorColor", "Foreground", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8520   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qborder_color, build_string ("black"),
  8521                          "borderColor", "BorderColor", RES_TYPE_STRING);
  8522   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qno_special_glyphs, Qnil,
  8523                          NULL, NULL, RES_TYPE_BOOLEAN);
  8524 
  8525   {
  8526 #ifndef USE_XCB
  8527     XSetWindowAttributes attrs;
  8528     unsigned long mask;
  8529     Atom type = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_net_window_type_tooltip;
  8530 
  8531     block_input ();
  8532     mask = (CWBackPixel | CWOverrideRedirect | CWEventMask
  8533             | CWCursor | CWColormap | CWBorderPixel);
  8534     if (DoesSaveUnders (dpyinfo->screen))
  8535       mask |= CWSaveUnder;
  8536 
  8537     /* Window managers look at the override-redirect flag to determine
  8538        whether or net to give windows a decoration (Xlib spec, chapter
  8539        3.2.8).  */
  8540     attrs.override_redirect = True;
  8541     attrs.save_under = True;
  8542     attrs.background_pixel = FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  8543     attrs.colormap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  8544     attrs.cursor =
  8545       f->output_data.x->current_cursor
  8546       = f->output_data.x->text_cursor;
  8547     attrs.border_pixel = f->output_data.x->border_pixel;
  8548     /* Arrange for getting MapNotify and UnmapNotify events.  */
  8549     attrs.event_mask = StructureNotifyMask;
  8550     tip_window
  8551       = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f)
  8552       = XCreateWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  8553                        FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  8554                        /* x, y, width, height */
  8555                        0, 0, 1, 1,
  8556                        /* Border.  */
  8557                        f->border_width,
  8558                        dpyinfo->n_planes, InputOutput,
  8559                        FRAME_X_VISUAL (f),
  8560                        mask, &attrs);
  8561     initial_set_up_x_back_buffer (f);
  8562     XChangeProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), tip_window,
  8563                      FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_net_window_type,
  8564                      XA_ATOM, 32, PropModeReplace,
  8565                      (unsigned char *)&type, 1);
  8566     unblock_input ();
  8567 #else
  8568     uint32_t value_list[6];
  8569     xcb_atom_t net_wm_window_type_tooltip
  8570       = (xcb_atom_t) dpyinfo->Xatom_net_window_type_tooltip;
  8571     xcb_visualid_t visual_id
  8572       = (xcb_visualid_t) XVisualIDFromVisual (FRAME_X_VISUAL (f));
  8573 
  8574     f->output_data.x->current_cursor = f->output_data.x->text_cursor;
  8575     /* Values are set in the order of their enumeration in `enum
  8576        xcb_cw_t'.  */
  8577     value_list[0] = FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  8578     value_list[1] = f->output_data.x->border_pixel;
  8579     value_list[2] = true;
  8580     value_list[3] = XCB_EVENT_MASK_STRUCTURE_NOTIFY;
  8581     value_list[4] = (xcb_colormap_t) FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  8582     value_list[5] = (xcb_cursor_t) f->output_data.x->text_cursor;
  8583 
  8584     block_input ();
  8585     tip_window
  8586       = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f)
  8587       = (Window) xcb_generate_id (dpyinfo->xcb_connection);
  8588 
  8589     xcb_create_window (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  8590                        dpyinfo->n_planes,
  8591                        (xcb_window_t) tip_window,
  8592                        (xcb_window_t) dpyinfo->root_window,
  8593                        0, 0, 1, 1, f->border_width,
  8594                        XCB_WINDOW_CLASS_INPUT_OUTPUT,
  8595                        visual_id,
  8596                        (XCB_CW_BACK_PIXEL
  8597                         | XCB_CW_BORDER_PIXEL
  8598                         | XCB_CW_OVERRIDE_REDIRECT
  8599                         | XCB_CW_EVENT_MASK
  8600                         | XCB_CW_COLORMAP
  8601                         | XCB_CW_CURSOR),
  8602                        &value_list);
  8603 
  8604     xcb_change_property (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
  8605                          XCB_PROP_MODE_REPLACE,
  8606                          (xcb_window_t) tip_window,
  8607                          (xcb_atom_t) dpyinfo->Xatom_net_window_type,
  8608                          (xcb_atom_t) dpyinfo->Xatom_ATOM,
  8609                          32, 1, &net_wm_window_type_tooltip);
  8610 
  8611     initial_set_up_x_back_buffer (f);
  8612     unblock_input ();
  8613 #endif
  8614   }
  8615 
  8616   /* Init faces before gui_default_parameter is called for the
  8617      scroll-bar-width parameter because otherwise we end up in
  8618      init_iterator with a null face cache, which should not happen.  */
  8619   init_frame_faces (f);
  8620 
  8621   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qinhibit_double_buffering, Qnil,
  8622                          "inhibitDoubleBuffering", "InhibitDoubleBuffering",
  8623                          RES_TYPE_BOOLEAN);
  8624 
  8625   gui_figure_window_size (f, parms, false, false);
  8626 
  8627   f->output_data.x->parent_desc = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window;
  8628 
  8629   x_make_gc (f);
  8630 
  8631   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qauto_raise, Qnil,
  8632                          "autoRaise", "AutoRaiseLower", RES_TYPE_BOOLEAN);
  8633   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qauto_lower, Qnil,
  8634                          "autoLower", "AutoRaiseLower", RES_TYPE_BOOLEAN);
  8635   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qcursor_type, Qbox,
  8636                          "cursorType", "CursorType", RES_TYPE_SYMBOL);
  8637   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qalpha, Qnil,
  8638                          "alpha", "Alpha", RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8639   gui_default_parameter (f, parms, Qalpha_background, Qnil,
  8640                          "alphaBackground", "AlphaBackground", RES_TYPE_NUMBER);
  8641 
  8642   /* Add `tooltip' frame parameter's default value. */
  8643   if (NILP (Fframe_parameter (frame, Qtooltip)))
  8644     {
  8645       AUTO_FRAME_ARG (arg, Qtooltip, Qt);
  8646       Fmodify_frame_parameters (frame, arg);
  8647     }
  8648 
  8649   /* FIXME - can this be done in a similar way to normal frames?
  8650      https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2007-10/msg00641.html */
  8651 
  8652   /* Set the `display-type' frame parameter before setting up faces. */
  8653   {
  8654     Lisp_Object disptype;
  8655 
  8656     if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes == 1)
  8657       disptype = Qmono;
  8658     else if (FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == GrayScale
  8659              || FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == StaticGray)
  8660       disptype = Qgrayscale;
  8661     else
  8662       disptype = Qcolor;
  8663 
  8664     if (NILP (Fframe_parameter (frame, Qdisplay_type)))
  8665       {
  8666         AUTO_FRAME_ARG (arg, Qdisplay_type, disptype);
  8667         Fmodify_frame_parameters (frame, arg);
  8668       }
  8669   }
  8670 
  8671   /* Set up faces after all frame parameters are known.  This call
  8672      also merges in face attributes specified for new frames.
  8673 
  8674      Frame parameters may be changed if .Xdefaults contains
  8675      specifications for the default font.  For example, if there is an
  8676      `Emacs.default.attributeBackground: pink', the `background-color'
  8677      attribute of the frame gets set, which let's the internal border
  8678      of the tooltip frame appear in pink.  Prevent this.  */
  8679   {
  8680     Lisp_Object bg = Fframe_parameter (frame, Qbackground_color);
  8681 
  8682     call2 (Qface_set_after_frame_default, frame, Qnil);
  8683 
  8684     if (!EQ (bg, Fframe_parameter (frame, Qbackground_color)))
  8685       {
  8686         AUTO_FRAME_ARG (arg, Qbackground_color, bg);
  8687         Fmodify_frame_parameters (frame, arg);
  8688       }
  8689   }
  8690 
  8691   f->no_split = true;
  8692 
  8693   /* Now that the frame will be official, it counts as a reference to
  8694      its display and terminal.  */
  8695   FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->reference_count++;
  8696   f->terminal->reference_count++;
  8697 
  8698   /* It is now ok to make the frame official even if we get an error
  8699      below.  And the frame needs to be on Vframe_list or making it
  8700      visible won't work.  */
  8701   Vframe_list = Fcons (frame, Vframe_list);
  8702   f->can_set_window_size = true;
  8703   adjust_frame_size (f, FRAME_TEXT_WIDTH (f), FRAME_TEXT_HEIGHT (f),
  8704                      0, true, Qtip_frame);
  8705 
  8706   /* Setting attributes of faces of the tooltip frame from resources
  8707      and similar will set face_change, which leads to the clearing of
  8708      all current matrices.  Since this isn't necessary here, avoid it
  8709      by resetting face_change to the value it had before we created
  8710      the tip frame.  */
  8711   face_change = face_change_before;
  8712 
  8713   /* Discard the unwind_protect.  */
  8714   return unbind_to (count, frame);
  8715 }
  8716 
  8717 
  8718 /* Compute where to display tip frame F.  PARMS is the list of frame
  8719    parameters for F.  DX and DY are specified offsets from the current
  8720    location of the mouse.  WIDTH and HEIGHT are the width and height
  8721    of the tooltip.  Return coordinates relative to the root window of
  8722    the display in *ROOT_X, and *ROOT_Y.  */
  8723 
  8724 static void
  8725 compute_tip_xy (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object parms, Lisp_Object dx,
  8726                 Lisp_Object dy, int width, int height, int *root_x,
  8727                 int *root_y)
  8728 {
  8729   Lisp_Object left, top, right, bottom;
  8730   int win_x, win_y;
  8731   Window root, child;
  8732   unsigned pmask;
  8733   int min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y = -1;
  8734 
  8735   /* User-specified position?  */
  8736   left = CDR (Fassq (Qleft, parms));
  8737   top  = CDR (Fassq (Qtop, parms));
  8738   right = CDR (Fassq (Qright, parms));
  8739   bottom = CDR (Fassq (Qbottom, parms));
  8740 
  8741   /* Move the tooltip window where the mouse pointer is.  Resize and
  8742      show it.  */
  8743   if ((!FIXNUMP (left) && !FIXNUMP (right))
  8744       || (!FIXNUMP (top) && !FIXNUMP (bottom)))
  8745     {
  8746       Lisp_Object frame, attributes, monitor, geometry;
  8747 
  8748       block_input ();
  8749       x_query_pointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  8750                        &root, &child, root_x, root_y, &win_x, &win_y, &pmask);
  8751       unblock_input ();
  8752 
  8753       XSETFRAME (frame, f);
  8754 
  8755 #if defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK
  8756       if (!NILP (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_monitor_attributes_list))
  8757         /* Use cached values if available to avoid fetching the
  8758            monitor list from the X server.  If XRandR is not
  8759            available, then fetching the attributes will probably not
  8760            sync anyway, and will thus be relatively harmless.  */
  8761         attributes = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_monitor_attributes_list;
  8762       else
  8763 #endif
  8764         attributes = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (frame);
  8765 
  8766       /* Try to determine the monitor where the mouse pointer is and
  8767          its geometry.  See bug#22549.  */
  8768       while (CONSP (attributes))
  8769         {
  8770           monitor = XCAR (attributes);
  8771           geometry = Fassq (Qgeometry, monitor);
  8772           if (CONSP (geometry))
  8773             {
  8774               min_x = XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (1), geometry));
  8775               min_y = XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (2), geometry));
  8776               max_x = min_x + XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (3), geometry));
  8777               max_y = min_y + XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (4), geometry));
  8778 
  8779               if (min_x <= *root_x && *root_x < max_x
  8780                   && min_y <= *root_y && *root_y < max_y)
  8781                 {
  8782                   break;
  8783                 }
  8784 
  8785               max_y = -1;
  8786             }
  8787 
  8788           attributes = XCDR (attributes);
  8789         }
  8790     }
  8791 
  8792   /* It was not possible to determine the monitor's geometry, so we
  8793      assign some sane defaults here: */
  8794   if (max_y < 0)
  8795     {
  8796       min_x = 0;
  8797       min_y = 0;
  8798       max_x = x_display_pixel_width (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  8799       max_y = x_display_pixel_height (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
  8800     }
  8801 
  8802   if (FIXNUMP (top))
  8803     *root_y = XFIXNUM (top);
  8804   else if (FIXNUMP (bottom))
  8805     *root_y = XFIXNUM (bottom) - height;
  8806   else if (*root_y + XFIXNUM (dy) <= min_y)
  8807     *root_y = min_y; /* Can happen for negative dy */
  8808   else if (*root_y + XFIXNUM (dy) + height <= max_y)
  8809     /* It fits below the pointer */
  8810     *root_y += XFIXNUM (dy);
  8811   else if (height + XFIXNUM (dy) + min_y <= *root_y)
  8812     /* It fits above the pointer.  */
  8813     *root_y -= height + XFIXNUM (dy);
  8814   else
  8815     /* Put it on the top.  */
  8816     *root_y = min_y;
  8817 
  8818   if (FIXNUMP (left))
  8819     *root_x = XFIXNUM (left);
  8820   else if (FIXNUMP (right))
  8821     *root_x = XFIXNUM (right) - width;
  8822   else if (*root_x + XFIXNUM (dx) <= min_x)
  8823     *root_x = 0; /* Can happen for negative dx */
  8824   else if (*root_x + XFIXNUM (dx) + width <= max_x)
  8825     /* It fits to the right of the pointer.  */
  8826     *root_x += XFIXNUM (dx);
  8827   else if (width + XFIXNUM (dx) + min_x <= *root_x)
  8828     /* It fits to the left of the pointer.  */
  8829     *root_x -= width + XFIXNUM (dx);
  8830   else
  8831     /* Put it left justified on the screen -- it ought to fit that way.  */
  8832     *root_x = min_x;
  8833 }
  8834 
  8835 
  8836 /**
  8837  * x_hide_tip:
  8838  *
  8839  * Hide currently visible tooltip and cancel its timer.
  8840  *
  8841  * If GTK+ system tooltips are used, this will try to hide the tooltip
  8842  * referenced by the x_output structure of tooltip_last_frame.  For
  8843  * Emacs tooltips this will try to make tooltip_frame invisible (if
  8844  * DELETE is false) or delete tooltip_frame (if DELETE is true).
  8845  *
  8846  * Return Qt if the tooltip was either deleted or made invisible, Qnil
  8847  * otherwise.
  8848  */
  8849 static Lisp_Object
  8850 x_hide_tip (bool delete)
  8851 {
  8852   if (!NILP (tip_timer))
  8853     {
  8854       call1 (Qcancel_timer, tip_timer);
  8855       tip_timer = Qnil;
  8856     }
  8857 
  8858 #ifdef USE_GTK
  8859   /* Any GTK+ system tooltip can be found via the x_output structure
  8860      of tip_last_frame, provided that frame is still live.  Any Emacs
  8861      tooltip is found via the tip_frame variable.  Note that the
  8862      current value of use_system_tooltips might not be the same as
  8863      used for the tooltip we have to hide, see Bug#30399.  */
  8864   if ((NILP (tip_last_frame) && NILP (tip_frame))
  8865       || (!use_system_tooltips
  8866           && !delete
  8867           && !NILP (tip_frame)
  8868           && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))
  8869           && !FRAME_VISIBLE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))))
  8870     /* Either there's no tooltip to hide or it's an already invisible
  8871        Emacs tooltip and we don't want to change its type.  Return
  8872        quickly.  */
  8873     return Qnil;
  8874   else
  8875     {
  8876       Lisp_Object was_open = Qnil;
  8877 
  8878       specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8879       specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  8880       specbind (Qinhibit_quit, Qt);
  8881 
  8882       /* Try to hide the GTK+ system tip first.  */
  8883       if (!NILP (tip_last_frame))
  8884         {
  8885           struct frame *f = XFRAME (tip_last_frame);
  8886 
  8887           if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  8888             {
  8889               if (xg_hide_tooltip (f))
  8890                 was_open = Qt;
  8891             }
  8892         }
  8893 
  8894       /* When using GTK+ system tooltips (compare Bug#41200) reset
  8895          tip_last_frame.  It will be reassigned when showing the next
  8896          GTK+ system tooltip.  */
  8897       if (use_system_tooltips)
  8898         tip_last_frame = Qnil;
  8899 
  8900       /* Now look whether there's an Emacs tip around.  */
  8901       if (!NILP (tip_frame))
  8902         {
  8903           struct frame *f = XFRAME (tip_frame);
  8904 
  8905           if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  8906             {
  8907               if (delete || use_system_tooltips)
  8908                 {
  8909                   /* Delete the Emacs tooltip frame when DELETE is true
  8910                      or we change the tooltip type from an Emacs one to
  8911                      a GTK+ system one.  */
  8912                   delete_frame (tip_frame, Qnil);
  8913                   tip_frame = Qnil;
  8914                 }
  8915               else
  8916                 x_make_frame_invisible (f);
  8917 
  8918               was_open = Qt;
  8919             }
  8920           else
  8921             tip_frame = Qnil;
  8922         }
  8923       else
  8924         tip_frame = Qnil;
  8925 
  8926       return unbind_to (count, was_open);
  8927     }
  8928 #else /* not USE_GTK */
  8929   if (NILP (tip_frame)
  8930       || (!delete
  8931           && !NILP (tip_frame)
  8932           && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))
  8933           && !FRAME_VISIBLE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))))
  8934     return Qnil;
  8935   else
  8936     {
  8937       Lisp_Object was_open = Qnil;
  8938 
  8939       specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  8940       specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  8941       specbind (Qinhibit_quit, Qt);
  8942 
  8943       if (!NILP (tip_frame))
  8944         {
  8945           struct frame *f = XFRAME (tip_frame);
  8946 
  8947           if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  8948             {
  8949               if (delete)
  8950                 {
  8951                   delete_frame (tip_frame, Qnil);
  8952                   tip_frame = Qnil;
  8953                 }
  8954               else
  8955                 x_make_frame_invisible (XFRAME (tip_frame));
  8956 
  8957               was_open = Qt;
  8958             }
  8959           else
  8960             tip_frame = Qnil;
  8961         }
  8962       else
  8963         tip_frame = Qnil;
  8964 
  8965       return unbind_to (count, was_open);
  8966     }
  8967 #endif /* USE_GTK */
  8968 }
  8969 
  8970 
  8971 DEFUN ("x-show-tip", Fx_show_tip, Sx_show_tip, 1, 6, 0,
  8972        doc: /* Show STRING in a "tooltip" window on frame FRAME.
  8973 A tooltip window is a small X window displaying a string.
  8974 
  8975 This is an internal function; Lisp code should call `tooltip-show'.
  8976 
  8977 FRAME nil or omitted means use the selected frame.
  8978 
  8979 PARMS is an optional list of frame parameters which can be used to
  8980 change the tooltip's appearance.
  8981 
  8982 Automatically hide the tooltip after TIMEOUT seconds.  TIMEOUT nil
  8983 means use the default timeout from the `x-show-tooltip-timeout'
  8984 variable.
  8985 
  8986 If the list of frame parameters PARMS contains a `left' parameter,
  8987 display the tooltip at that x-position.  If the list of frame parameters
  8988 PARMS contains no `left' but a `right' parameter, display the tooltip
  8989 right-adjusted at that x-position. Otherwise display it at the
  8990 x-position of the mouse, with offset DX added (default is 5 if DX isn't
  8991 specified).
  8992 
  8993 Likewise for the y-position: If a `top' frame parameter is specified, it
  8994 determines the position of the upper edge of the tooltip window.  If a
  8995 `bottom' parameter but no `top' frame parameter is specified, it
  8996 determines the position of the lower edge of the tooltip window.
  8997 Otherwise display the tooltip window at the y-position of the mouse,
  8998 with offset DY added (default is -10).
  8999 
  9000 A tooltip's maximum size is specified by `x-max-tooltip-size'.
  9001 Text larger than the specified size is clipped.  */)
  9002   (Lisp_Object string, Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object parms,
  9003    Lisp_Object timeout, Lisp_Object dx, Lisp_Object dy)
  9004 {
  9005   struct frame *f, *tip_f;
  9006   struct window *w;
  9007   int root_x, root_y;
  9008   struct buffer *old_buffer;
  9009   struct text_pos pos;
  9010   int width, height;
  9011   int old_windows_or_buffers_changed = windows_or_buffers_changed;
  9012   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9013   Lisp_Object window, size, tip_buf;
  9014   bool displayed;
  9015 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKING
  9016   struct glyph_row *row, *end;
  9017 #endif
  9018   AUTO_STRING (tip, " *tip*");
  9019 
  9020   specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  9021 
  9022   CHECK_STRING (string);
  9023   if (SCHARS (string) == 0)
  9024     string = make_unibyte_string (" ", 1);
  9025 
  9026   if (NILP (frame))
  9027     frame = selected_frame;
  9028   f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  9029 
  9030   if (NILP (timeout))
  9031     timeout = Vx_show_tooltip_timeout;
  9032   CHECK_FIXNAT (timeout);
  9033 
  9034   if (NILP (dx))
  9035     dx = make_fixnum (5);
  9036   else
  9037     CHECK_FIXNUM (dx);
  9038 
  9039   if (NILP (dy))
  9040     dy = make_fixnum (-10);
  9041   else
  9042     CHECK_FIXNUM (dy);
  9043 
  9044   tip_dx = dx;
  9045   tip_dy = dy;
  9046 
  9047 #ifdef USE_GTK
  9048   if (use_system_tooltips)
  9049     {
  9050       bool ok;
  9051 
  9052       /* Hide a previous tip, if any.  */
  9053       Fx_hide_tip ();
  9054 
  9055       block_input ();
  9056       ok = xg_prepare_tooltip (f, string, &width, &height);
  9057       if (ok)
  9058         {
  9059           compute_tip_xy (f, parms, dx, dy, width, height, &root_x, &root_y);
  9060           xg_show_tooltip (f, root_x, root_y);
  9061           tip_last_frame = frame;
  9062         }
  9063 
  9064       unblock_input ();
  9065       if (ok) goto start_timer;
  9066     }
  9067 #endif /* USE_GTK */
  9068 
  9069   if (!NILP (tip_frame) && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame)))
  9070     {
  9071       if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))
  9072           && (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (XFRAME (frame))
  9073               == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (XFRAME (tip_last_frame)))
  9074           && !NILP (Fequal_including_properties (tip_last_string, string))
  9075           && !NILP (Fequal (tip_last_parms, parms)))
  9076         {
  9077           /* Only DX and DY have changed.  */
  9078           tip_f = XFRAME (tip_frame);
  9079           if (!NILP (tip_timer))
  9080             {
  9081               call1 (Qcancel_timer, tip_timer);
  9082               tip_timer = Qnil;
  9083             }
  9084 
  9085           block_input ();
  9086           compute_tip_xy (tip_f, parms, dx, dy, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (tip_f),
  9087                           FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (tip_f), &root_x, &root_y);
  9088           XMoveWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (tip_f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (tip_f),
  9089                        root_x, root_y);
  9090           unblock_input ();
  9091 
  9092           goto start_timer;
  9093         }
  9094       else if (tooltip_reuse_hidden_frame && BASE_EQ (frame, tip_last_frame))
  9095         {
  9096           bool delete = false;
  9097           Lisp_Object tail, elt, parm, last;
  9098 
  9099           /* Check if every parameter in PARMS has the same value in
  9100              tip_last_parms.  This may destruct tip_last_parms which,
  9101              however, will be recreated below.  */
  9102           for (tail = parms; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9103             {
  9104               elt = XCAR (tail);
  9105               parm = CAR (elt);
  9106               /* The left, top, right and bottom parameters are handled
  9107                  by compute_tip_xy so they can be ignored here.  */
  9108               if (!EQ (parm, Qleft) && !EQ (parm, Qtop)
  9109                   && !EQ (parm, Qright) && !EQ (parm, Qbottom))
  9110                 {
  9111                   last = Fassq (parm, tip_last_parms);
  9112                   if (NILP (Fequal (CDR (elt), CDR (last))))
  9113                     {
  9114                       /* We lost, delete the old tooltip.  */
  9115                       delete = true;
  9116                       break;
  9117                     }
  9118                   else
  9119                     tip_last_parms =
  9120                       call2 (Qassq_delete_all, parm, tip_last_parms);
  9121                 }
  9122               else
  9123                 tip_last_parms =
  9124                   call2 (Qassq_delete_all, parm, tip_last_parms);
  9125             }
  9126 
  9127           /* Now check if every parameter in what is left of
  9128              tip_last_parms with a non-nil value has an association in
  9129              PARMS.  */
  9130           for (tail = tip_last_parms; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  9131             {
  9132               elt = XCAR (tail);
  9133               parm = CAR (elt);
  9134               if (!EQ (parm, Qleft) && !EQ (parm, Qtop) && !EQ (parm, Qright)
  9135                   && !EQ (parm, Qbottom) && !NILP (CDR (elt)))
  9136                 {
  9137                   /* We lost, delete the old tooltip.  */
  9138                   delete = true;
  9139                   break;
  9140                 }
  9141             }
  9142 
  9143           x_hide_tip (delete);
  9144         }
  9145       else
  9146         x_hide_tip (true);
  9147     }
  9148   else
  9149     x_hide_tip (true);
  9150 
  9151   tip_last_frame = frame;
  9152   tip_last_string = string;
  9153   tip_last_parms = parms;
  9154 
  9155   if (NILP (tip_frame) || !FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame)))
  9156     {
  9157       /* Add default values to frame parameters.  */
  9158       if (NILP (Fassq (Qname, parms)))
  9159         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qname, build_string ("tooltip")), parms);
  9160       if (NILP (Fassq (Qinternal_border_width, parms)))
  9161         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qinternal_border_width, make_fixnum (3)), parms);
  9162       if (NILP (Fassq (Qborder_width, parms)))
  9163         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qborder_width, make_fixnum (1)), parms);
  9164       if (NILP (Fassq (Qborder_color, parms)))
  9165         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qborder_color, build_string ("lightyellow")), parms);
  9166       if (NILP (Fassq (Qbackground_color, parms)))
  9167         parms = Fcons (Fcons (Qbackground_color, build_string ("lightyellow")),
  9168                        parms);
  9169 
  9170       /* Create a frame for the tooltip, and record it in the global
  9171          variable tip_frame.  */
  9172       if (NILP (tip_frame = x_create_tip_frame (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), parms)))
  9173         /* Creating the tip frame failed.  */
  9174         return unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  9175     }
  9176 
  9177   tip_f = XFRAME (tip_frame);
  9178   window = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (tip_f);
  9179   tip_buf = Fget_buffer_create (tip, Qnil);
  9180   /* We will mark the tip window a "pseudo-window" below, and such
  9181      windows cannot have display margins.  */
  9182   bset_left_margin_cols (XBUFFER (tip_buf), make_fixnum (0));
  9183   bset_right_margin_cols (XBUFFER (tip_buf), make_fixnum (0));
  9184   set_window_buffer (window, tip_buf, false, false);
  9185   w = XWINDOW (window);
  9186   w->pseudo_window_p = true;
  9187   /* Try to avoid that `other-window' select us (Bug#47207).  */
  9188   Fset_window_parameter (window, Qno_other_window, Qt);
  9189 
  9190   /* Set up the frame's root window.  Note: The following code does not
  9191      try to size the window or its frame correctly.  Its only purpose is
  9192      to make the subsequent text size calculations work.  The right
  9193      sizes should get installed when the toolkit gets back to us.  */
  9194   w->left_col = 0;
  9195   w->top_line = 0;
  9196   w->pixel_left = 0;
  9197   w->pixel_top = 0;
  9198 
  9199   if (CONSP (Vx_max_tooltip_size)
  9200       && RANGED_FIXNUMP (1, XCAR (Vx_max_tooltip_size), INT_MAX)
  9201       && RANGED_FIXNUMP (1, XCDR (Vx_max_tooltip_size), INT_MAX))
  9202     {
  9203       w->total_cols = XFIXNAT (XCAR (Vx_max_tooltip_size));
  9204       w->total_lines = XFIXNAT (XCDR (Vx_max_tooltip_size));
  9205     }
  9206   else
  9207     {
  9208       w->total_cols = 80;
  9209       w->total_lines = 40;
  9210     }
  9211 
  9212   w->pixel_width = w->total_cols * FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (tip_f);
  9213   w->pixel_height = w->total_lines * FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (tip_f);
  9214   FRAME_TOTAL_COLS (tip_f) = w->total_cols;
  9215   adjust_frame_glyphs (tip_f);
  9216 
  9217   /* Insert STRING into root window's buffer and fit the frame to the
  9218      buffer.  */
  9219   specpdl_ref count_1 = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9220   old_buffer = current_buffer;
  9221   set_buffer_internal_1 (XBUFFER (w->contents));
  9222   bset_truncate_lines (current_buffer, Qnil);
  9223   specbind (Qinhibit_read_only, Qt);
  9224   specbind (Qinhibit_modification_hooks, Qt);
  9225   specbind (Qinhibit_point_motion_hooks, Qt);
  9226   Ferase_buffer ();
  9227   Finsert (1, &string);
  9228   clear_glyph_matrix (w->desired_matrix);
  9229   clear_glyph_matrix (w->current_matrix);
  9230   SET_TEXT_POS (pos, BEGV, BEGV_BYTE);
  9231   displayed = try_window (window, pos, TRY_WINDOW_IGNORE_FONTS_CHANGE);
  9232 
  9233   if (!displayed && NILP (Vx_max_tooltip_size))
  9234     {
  9235 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKING
  9236       row = w->desired_matrix->rows;
  9237       end = w->desired_matrix->rows + w->desired_matrix->nrows;
  9238 
  9239       while (row < end)
  9240         {
  9241           if (!row->displays_text_p
  9242               || row->ends_at_zv_p)
  9243             break;
  9244           ++row;
  9245         }
  9246 
  9247       eassert (row < end && row->ends_at_zv_p);
  9248 #endif
  9249     }
  9250 
  9251   /* Calculate size of tooltip window.  */
  9252   size = Fwindow_text_pixel_size (window, Qnil, Qnil, Qnil,
  9253                                   make_fixnum (w->pixel_height), Qnil,
  9254                                   Qnil);
  9255   /* Add the frame's internal border to calculated size.  */
  9256   width = XFIXNUM (CAR (size)) + 2 * FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (tip_f);
  9257   height = XFIXNUM (CDR (size)) + 2 * FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (tip_f);
  9258 
  9259   /* Calculate position of tooltip frame.  */
  9260   compute_tip_xy (tip_f, parms, dx, dy, width, height, &root_x, &root_y);
  9261 
  9262   /* Show tooltip frame.  */
  9263   block_input ();
  9264 #ifndef USE_XCB
  9265   XMoveResizeWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (tip_f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (tip_f),
  9266                      root_x, root_y, width, height);
  9267   XMapRaised (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (tip_f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (tip_f));
  9268 #else
  9269   uint32_t values[] = { root_x, root_y, width, height, XCB_STACK_MODE_ABOVE };
  9270 
  9271   xcb_configure_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (tip_f)->xcb_connection,
  9272                         (xcb_window_t) FRAME_X_WINDOW (tip_f),
  9273                         (XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_X
  9274                          | XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_Y
  9275                          | XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_WIDTH
  9276                          | XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_HEIGHT
  9277                          | XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_STACK_MODE), &values);
  9278   xcb_map_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (tip_f)->xcb_connection,
  9279                   (xcb_window_t) FRAME_X_WINDOW (tip_f));
  9280 #endif
  9281   unblock_input ();
  9282 
  9283 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  9284   x_cr_update_surface_desired_size (tip_f, width, height);
  9285 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  9286 
  9287   w->must_be_updated_p = true;
  9288   update_single_window (w);
  9289   flush_frame (tip_f);
  9290   set_buffer_internal_1 (old_buffer);
  9291   unbind_to (count_1, Qnil);
  9292   windows_or_buffers_changed = old_windows_or_buffers_changed;
  9293 
  9294  start_timer:
  9295   /* Let the tip disappear after timeout seconds.  */
  9296   tip_timer = call3 (Qrun_at_time, timeout, Qnil,
  9297                      Qx_hide_tip);
  9298 
  9299   return unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  9300 }
  9301 
  9302 
  9303 DEFUN ("x-hide-tip", Fx_hide_tip, Sx_hide_tip, 0, 0, 0,
  9304        doc: /* Hide the current tooltip window, if there is any.
  9305 Value is t if tooltip was open, nil otherwise.  */)
  9306   (void)
  9307 {
  9308   return x_hide_tip (!tooltip_reuse_hidden_frame);
  9309 }
  9310 
  9311 DEFUN ("x-double-buffered-p", Fx_double_buffered_p, Sx_double_buffered_p,
  9312        0, 1, 0,
  9313        doc: /* Return t if FRAME is being double buffered.  */)
  9314      (Lisp_Object frame)
  9315 {
  9316 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  9317   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
  9318   return FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f) ? Qt : Qnil;
  9319 #else
  9320   return Qnil;
  9321 #endif
  9322 }
  9323 
  9324 
  9325 /***********************************************************************
  9326                         File selection dialog
  9327  ***********************************************************************/
  9328 
  9329 DEFUN ("x-uses-old-gtk-dialog", Fx_uses_old_gtk_dialog,
  9330        Sx_uses_old_gtk_dialog,
  9331        0, 0, 0,
  9332        doc: /* Return t if the old Gtk+ file selection dialog is used.  */)
  9333   (void)
  9334 {
  9335 #ifdef USE_GTK
  9336   if (use_dialog_box
  9337       && use_file_dialog
  9338       && window_system_available (SELECTED_FRAME ())
  9339       && xg_uses_old_file_dialog ())
  9340     return Qt;
  9341 #endif
  9342   return Qnil;
  9343 }
  9344 
  9345 
  9346 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
  9347 /* Callback for "OK" and "Cancel" on file selection dialog.  */
  9348 
  9349 static void
  9350 file_dialog_cb (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, XtPointer call_data)
  9351 {
  9352   int *result = client_data;
  9353   XmAnyCallbackStruct *cb = call_data;
  9354   *result = cb->reason;
  9355 }
  9356 
  9357 
  9358 /* Callback for unmapping a file selection dialog.  This is used to
  9359    capture the case where a dialog is closed via a window manager's
  9360    closer button, for example. Using a XmNdestroyCallback didn't work
  9361    in this case.  */
  9362 
  9363 static void
  9364 file_dialog_unmap_cb (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, XtPointer call_data)
  9365 {
  9366   int *result = client_data;
  9367   *result = XmCR_CANCEL;
  9368 }
  9369 
  9370 static void
  9371 clean_up_file_dialog (void *arg)
  9372 {
  9373   Widget dialog = arg;
  9374 
  9375   /* Clean up.  */
  9376   block_input ();
  9377   XtUnmanageChild (dialog);
  9378   XtDestroyWidget (dialog);
  9379   x_menu_set_in_use (false);
  9380   unblock_input ();
  9381 }
  9382 
  9383 
  9384 DEFUN ("x-file-dialog", Fx_file_dialog, Sx_file_dialog, 2, 5, 0,
  9385        doc: /* SKIP: real doc in USE_GTK definition in xfns.c.  */)
  9386   (Lisp_Object prompt, Lisp_Object dir, Lisp_Object default_filename,
  9387    Lisp_Object mustmatch, Lisp_Object only_dir_p)
  9388 {
  9389   int result;
  9390   struct frame *f = SELECTED_FRAME ();
  9391   Lisp_Object file = Qnil;
  9392   Lisp_Object decoded_file;
  9393   Widget dialog, text, help;
  9394   Arg al[10];
  9395   int ac = 0;
  9396   XmString dir_xmstring, pattern_xmstring;
  9397   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9398 
  9399   check_window_system (f);
  9400 
  9401   if (popup_activated ())
  9402     error ("Trying to use a menu from within a menu-entry");
  9403 
  9404   CHECK_STRING (prompt);
  9405   CHECK_STRING (dir);
  9406 
  9407   /* Prevent redisplay.  */
  9408   specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  9409 
  9410   /* Defer selection requests.  */
  9411   DEFER_SELECTIONS;
  9412 
  9413   block_input ();
  9414 
  9415   /* Create the dialog with PROMPT as title, using DIR as initial
  9416      directory and using "*" as pattern.  */
  9417   dir = Fexpand_file_name (dir, Qnil);
  9418   dir_xmstring = XmStringCreateLocalized (SSDATA (dir));
  9419   pattern_xmstring = XmStringCreateLocalized ("*");
  9420 
  9421   XtSetArg (al[ac], XmNtitle, SDATA (prompt)); ++ac;
  9422   XtSetArg (al[ac], XmNdirectory, dir_xmstring); ++ac;
  9423   XtSetArg (al[ac], XmNpattern, pattern_xmstring); ++ac;
  9424   XtSetArg (al[ac], XmNresizePolicy, XmRESIZE_GROW); ++ac;
  9425   XtSetArg (al[ac], XmNdialogStyle, XmDIALOG_APPLICATION_MODAL); ++ac;
  9426   dialog = XmCreateFileSelectionDialog (f->output_data.x->widget,
  9427                                         "fsb", al, ac);
  9428   XmStringFree (dir_xmstring);
  9429   XmStringFree (pattern_xmstring);
  9430 
  9431   /* Add callbacks for OK and Cancel.  */
  9432   XtAddCallback (dialog, XmNokCallback, file_dialog_cb,
  9433                  (XtPointer) &result);
  9434   XtAddCallback (dialog, XmNcancelCallback, file_dialog_cb,
  9435                  (XtPointer) &result);
  9436   XtAddCallback (dialog, XmNunmapCallback, file_dialog_unmap_cb,
  9437                  (XtPointer) &result);
  9438 
  9439   /* Remove the help button since we can't display help.  */
  9440   help = XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_HELP_BUTTON);
  9441   XtUnmanageChild (help);
  9442 
  9443   /* Mark OK button as default.  */
  9444   XtVaSetValues (XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_OK_BUTTON),
  9445                  XmNshowAsDefault, True, NULL);
  9446 
  9447   /* If MUSTMATCH is non-nil, disable the file entry field of the
  9448      dialog, so that the user must select a file from the files list
  9449      box.  We can't remove it because we wouldn't have a way to get at
  9450      the result file name, then.  */
  9451   text = XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_TEXT);
  9452   if (!NILP (mustmatch))
  9453     {
  9454       Widget label;
  9455       label = XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_SELECTION_LABEL);
  9456       XtSetSensitive (text, False);
  9457       XtSetSensitive (label, False);
  9458     }
  9459 
  9460   /* Manage the dialog, so that list boxes get filled.  */
  9461   XtManageChild (dialog);
  9462 
  9463   if (STRINGP (default_filename))
  9464     {
  9465       XmString default_xmstring;
  9466       Widget wtext = XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_TEXT);
  9467       Widget list = XmFileSelectionBoxGetChild (dialog, XmDIALOG_LIST);
  9468 
  9469       XmTextPosition last_pos = XmTextFieldGetLastPosition (wtext);
  9470       XmTextFieldReplace (wtext, 0, last_pos,
  9471                           (SSDATA (Ffile_name_nondirectory (default_filename))));
  9472 
  9473       /* Select DEFAULT_FILENAME in the files list box.  DEFAULT_FILENAME
  9474          must include the path for this to work.  */
  9475 
  9476       default_xmstring = XmStringCreateLocalized (SSDATA (default_filename));
  9477 
  9478       if (XmListItemExists (list, default_xmstring))
  9479         {
  9480           int item_pos = XmListItemPos (list, default_xmstring);
  9481           /* Select the item and scroll it into view.  */
  9482           XmListSelectPos (list, item_pos, True);
  9483           XmListSetPos (list, item_pos);
  9484         }
  9485 
  9486       XmStringFree (default_xmstring);
  9487     }
  9488 
  9489   record_unwind_protect_ptr (clean_up_file_dialog, dialog);
  9490 
  9491   /* Process events until the user presses Cancel or OK.  */
  9492   x_menu_set_in_use (true);
  9493   result = 0;
  9494   while (result == 0)
  9495     {
  9496       XEvent event, copy;
  9497       x_menu_wait_for_event (0);
  9498 
  9499       if (XtAppPending (Xt_app_con))
  9500         {
  9501           XtAppNextEvent (Xt_app_con, &event);
  9502 
  9503           copy = event;
  9504           if (event.type == KeyPress
  9505               && FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f) == event.xkey.display)
  9506             {
  9507               KeySym keysym = XLookupKeysym (&event.xkey, 0);
  9508 
  9509               /* Pop down on C-g.  */
  9510               if (keysym == XK_g && (event.xkey.state & ControlMask) != 0)
  9511                 XtUnmanageChild (dialog);
  9512             }
  9513 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
  9514           else if (event.type == GenericEvent
  9515                    && FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f) == event.xgeneric.display
  9516                    && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2
  9517                    && (event.xgeneric.extension
  9518                        == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xi2_opcode)
  9519                    && event.xgeneric.evtype == XI_KeyPress)
  9520             {
  9521               KeySym keysym;
  9522               XIDeviceEvent *xev;
  9523 
  9524               if (event.xcookie.data)
  9525                 emacs_abort ();
  9526 
  9527               if (XGetEventData (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), &event.xcookie))
  9528                 {
  9529                   xev = (XIDeviceEvent *) event.xcookie.data;
  9530 
  9531                   copy.xkey.type = KeyPress;
  9532                   copy.xkey.serial = xev->serial;
  9533                   copy.xkey.send_event = xev->send_event;
  9534                   copy.xkey.display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  9535                   copy.xkey.window = xev->event;
  9536                   copy.xkey.root = xev->root;
  9537                   copy.xkey.subwindow = xev->child;
  9538                   copy.xkey.time = xev->time;
  9539                   copy.xkey.x = lrint (xev->event_x);
  9540                   copy.xkey.y = lrint (xev->event_y);
  9541                   copy.xkey.x_root = lrint (xev->root_x);
  9542                   copy.xkey.y_root = lrint (xev->root_y);
  9543                   copy.xkey.state = xev->mods.effective;
  9544                   copy.xkey.keycode = xev->detail;
  9545                   copy.xkey.same_screen = True;
  9546 
  9547                   keysym = XLookupKeysym (&copy.xkey, 0);
  9548 
  9549                   if (keysym == XK_g
  9550                       && (copy.xkey.state & ControlMask) != 0) /* Any escape, ignore modifiers.  */
  9551                     XtUnmanageChild (dialog);
  9552 
  9553                   XFreeEventData (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), &event.xcookie);
  9554                 }
  9555             }
  9556 #endif
  9557 
  9558           (void) x_dispatch_event (&copy, FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
  9559         }
  9560     }
  9561 
  9562   /* Get the result.  */
  9563   if (result == XmCR_OK)
  9564     {
  9565       XmString text_string;
  9566       String data;
  9567 
  9568       XtVaGetValues (dialog, XmNtextString, &text_string, NULL);
  9569       XmStringGetLtoR (text_string, XmFONTLIST_DEFAULT_TAG, &data);
  9570       XmStringFree (text_string);
  9571       file = build_string (data);
  9572       XtFree (data);
  9573     }
  9574   else
  9575     file = Qnil;
  9576 
  9577   unblock_input ();
  9578 
  9579   /* Make "Cancel" equivalent to C-g.  */
  9580   if (NILP (file))
  9581     quit ();
  9582 
  9583   decoded_file = DECODE_FILE (file);
  9584 
  9585   return unbind_to (count, decoded_file);
  9586 }
  9587 
  9588 #endif /* USE_MOTIF */
  9589 
  9590 #ifdef USE_GTK
  9591 
  9592 static void
  9593 clean_up_dialog (void)
  9594 {
  9595   x_menu_set_in_use (false);
  9596 }
  9597 
  9598 DEFUN ("x-file-dialog", Fx_file_dialog, Sx_file_dialog, 2, 5, 0,
  9599        doc: /* Read file name, prompting with PROMPT in directory DIR.
  9600 Use a file selection dialog.  Select DEFAULT-FILENAME in the dialog's file
  9601 selection box, if specified.  If MUSTMATCH is non-nil, the returned file
  9602 or directory must exist.
  9603 
  9604 This function is defined only on NS, Haiku, MS Windows, and X Windows with the
  9605 Motif or Gtk toolkits.  With the Motif toolkit, ONLY-DIR-P is ignored.
  9606 Otherwise, if ONLY-DIR-P is non-nil, the user can select only directories.
  9607 On MS Windows 7 and later, the file selection dialog "remembers" the last
  9608 directory where the user selected a file, and will open that directory
  9609 instead of DIR on subsequent invocations of this function with the same
  9610 value of DIR as in previous invocations; this is standard MS Windows behavior.  */)
  9611   (Lisp_Object prompt, Lisp_Object dir, Lisp_Object default_filename, Lisp_Object mustmatch, Lisp_Object only_dir_p)
  9612 {
  9613   struct frame *f = SELECTED_FRAME ();
  9614   char *fn;
  9615   Lisp_Object file = Qnil;
  9616   Lisp_Object decoded_file;
  9617   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9618   char *cdef_file;
  9619 
  9620   check_window_system (f);
  9621 
  9622   if (popup_activated ())
  9623     error ("Trying to use a menu from within a menu-entry");
  9624   else
  9625     x_menu_set_in_use (true);
  9626 
  9627   CHECK_STRING (prompt);
  9628   CHECK_STRING (dir);
  9629 
  9630   /* Prevent redisplay.  */
  9631   specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  9632   record_unwind_protect_void (clean_up_dialog);
  9633 
  9634   block_input ();
  9635 
  9636   if (STRINGP (default_filename))
  9637     cdef_file = SSDATA (default_filename);
  9638   else
  9639     cdef_file = SSDATA (dir);
  9640 
  9641   fn = xg_get_file_name (f, SSDATA (prompt), cdef_file,
  9642                          ! NILP (mustmatch),
  9643                          ! NILP (only_dir_p));
  9644 
  9645   if (fn)
  9646     {
  9647       file = build_string (fn);
  9648       xfree (fn);
  9649     }
  9650 
  9651   unblock_input ();
  9652 
  9653   /* Make "Cancel" equivalent to C-g.  */
  9654   if (NILP (file))
  9655     quit ();
  9656 
  9657   decoded_file = DECODE_FILE (file);
  9658 
  9659   return unbind_to (count, decoded_file);
  9660 }
  9661 
  9662 
  9663 #ifdef HAVE_FREETYPE
  9664 
  9665 DEFUN ("x-select-font", Fx_select_font, Sx_select_font, 0, 2, 0,
  9666        doc: /* Read a font using a GTK dialog.
  9667 Return either a font spec (for GTK versions >= 3.2) or a string
  9668 containing a GTK-style font name.
  9669 
  9670 FRAME is the frame on which to pop up the font chooser.  If omitted or
  9671 nil, it defaults to the selected frame. */)
  9672   (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object ignored)
  9673 {
  9674   struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  9675   Lisp_Object font;
  9676   Lisp_Object font_param;
  9677   char *default_name = NULL;
  9678   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9679 
  9680   if (popup_activated ())
  9681     error ("Trying to use a menu from within a menu-entry");
  9682   else
  9683     x_menu_set_in_use (true);
  9684 
  9685   /* Prevent redisplay.  */
  9686   specbind (Qinhibit_redisplay, Qt);
  9687   record_unwind_protect_void (clean_up_dialog);
  9688 
  9689   block_input ();
  9690 
  9691   XSETFONT (font, FRAME_FONT (f));
  9692   font_param = Ffont_get (font, QCname);
  9693   if (STRINGP (font_param))
  9694     default_name = xlispstrdup (font_param);
  9695   else
  9696     {
  9697       font_param = Fframe_parameter (frame, Qfont_parameter);
  9698       if (STRINGP (font_param))
  9699         default_name = xlispstrdup (font_param);
  9700     }
  9701 
  9702   font = xg_get_font (f, default_name);
  9703   xfree (default_name);
  9704 
  9705   unblock_input ();
  9706 
  9707   if (NILP (font))
  9708     quit ();
  9709 
  9710   return unbind_to (count, font);
  9711 }
  9712 #endif /* HAVE_FREETYPE */
  9713 
  9714 #endif /* USE_GTK */
  9715 
  9716 
  9717 /***********************************************************************
  9718                                Keyboard
  9719  ***********************************************************************/
  9720 
  9721 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
  9722 #include <X11/XKBlib.h>
  9723 #include <X11/keysym.h>
  9724 #endif
  9725 
  9726 DEFUN ("x-backspace-delete-keys-p", Fx_backspace_delete_keys_p,
  9727        Sx_backspace_delete_keys_p, 0, 1, 0,
  9728        doc: /* Check if both Backspace and Delete keys are on the keyboard of FRAME.
  9729 FRAME nil means use the selected frame.
  9730 Value is t if we know that both keys are present, and are mapped to the
  9731 usual X keysyms.  Value is `lambda' if we cannot determine if both keys are
  9732 present and mapped to the usual X keysyms.  */)
  9733   (Lisp_Object frame)
  9734 {
  9735 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
  9736   XkbDescPtr kb;
  9737   struct frame *f;
  9738   Display *dpy;
  9739   Lisp_Object have_keys;
  9740   int delete_keycode, backspace_keycode, i;
  9741 #endif
  9742 
  9743 #ifndef HAVE_XKB
  9744   return Qlambda;
  9745 #else
  9746   delete_keycode = 0;
  9747   backspace_keycode = 0;
  9748   f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  9749   dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  9750 
  9751   if (!FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xkb)
  9752     return Qlambda;
  9753 
  9754   block_input ();
  9755 
  9756   /* In this code we check that the keyboard has physical keys with names
  9757      that start with BKSP (Backspace) and DELE (Delete), and that they
  9758      generate keysym XK_BackSpace and XK_Delete respectively.
  9759      This function is used to test if normal-erase-is-backspace should be
  9760      turned on.
  9761      An alternative approach would be to just check if XK_BackSpace and
  9762      XK_Delete are mapped to any key.  But if any of those are mapped to
  9763      some non-intuitive key combination (Meta-Shift-Ctrl-whatever) and the
  9764      user doesn't know about it, it is better to return false here.
  9765      It is more obvious to the user what to do if there are two keys
  9766      clearly marked with names/symbols and one key does something not
  9767      expected (and the user then tries the other).
  9768      The cases where Backspace/Delete is mapped to some other key combination
  9769      are rare, and in those cases, normal-erase-is-backspace can be turned on
  9770      manually.  */
  9771 
  9772   have_keys = Qnil;
  9773   kb = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xkb_desc;
  9774   if (kb && kb->names)
  9775     {
  9776       for (i = kb->min_key_code; (i < kb->max_key_code
  9777                                   && (delete_keycode == 0
  9778                                       || backspace_keycode == 0));
  9779            ++i)
  9780         {
  9781           /* The XKB symbolic key names can be seen most easily in
  9782              the PS file generated by `xkbprint -label name
  9783              $DISPLAY'.  */
  9784           if (!memcmp ("DELE", kb->names->keys[i].name, 4))
  9785             delete_keycode = i;
  9786           else if (!memcmp ("BKSP", kb->names->keys[i].name, 4))
  9787             backspace_keycode = i;
  9788         }
  9789 
  9790       if (delete_keycode && backspace_keycode
  9791           && XKeysymToKeycode (dpy, XK_Delete) == delete_keycode
  9792           && XKeysymToKeycode (dpy, XK_BackSpace) == backspace_keycode)
  9793         have_keys = Qt;
  9794     }
  9795   else
  9796     /* The keyboard names couldn't be obtained for some reason.  */
  9797     have_keys = Qlambda;
  9798   unblock_input ();
  9799   return have_keys;
  9800 #endif
  9801 }
  9802 
  9803 DEFUN ("x-get-modifier-masks", Fx_get_modifier_masks, Sx_get_modifier_masks,
  9804        0, 1, 0,
  9805        doc: /* Return the X modifier masks corresponding to keyboard modifiers.
  9806 The optional second argument TERMINAL specifies which display to fetch
  9807 modifier masks from.  TERMINAL should be a terminal object, a frame or
  9808 a display name (a string).  If TERMINAL is omitted or nil, that stands
  9809 for the selected frame's display.
  9810 
  9811 Return a list of (HYPER SUPER ALT SHIFT-LOCK META), each element being
  9812 a number describing the modifier mask for the corresponding Emacs
  9813 modifier.  */)
  9814   (Lisp_Object terminal)
  9815 {
  9816   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  9817 
  9818   dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
  9819   return x_get_keyboard_modifiers (dpyinfo);
  9820 }
  9821 
  9822 
  9823 /***********************************************************************
  9824                                Printing
  9825  ***********************************************************************/
  9826 
  9827 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  9828 DEFUN ("x-export-frames", Fx_export_frames, Sx_export_frames, 0, 2, 0,
  9829        doc: /* Return image data of FRAMES in TYPE format.
  9830 FRAMES should be nil (the selected frame), a frame, or a list of
  9831 frames (each of which corresponds to one page).  Each frame should be
  9832 visible.  Optional arg TYPE should be either `pdf' (default), `png',
  9833 `postscript', or `svg'.  Supported types are determined by the
  9834 compile-time configuration of cairo.
  9835 
  9836 Note: Text drawn with the `x' font backend is shown with hollow boxes
  9837 unless TYPE is `png'.  */)
  9838      (Lisp_Object frames, Lisp_Object type)
  9839 {
  9840   Lisp_Object rest, tmp;
  9841   cairo_surface_type_t surface_type;
  9842 
  9843   if (!CONSP (frames))
  9844     frames = list1 (frames);
  9845 
  9846   tmp = Qnil;
  9847   for (rest = frames; CONSP (rest); rest = XCDR (rest))
  9848     {
  9849       struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (XCAR (rest));
  9850       Lisp_Object frame;
  9851 
  9852       XSETFRAME (frame, f);
  9853       if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
  9854         error ("Frames to be exported must be visible.");
  9855       tmp = Fcons (frame, tmp);
  9856     }
  9857   frames = Fnreverse (tmp);
  9858 
  9859 #ifdef CAIRO_HAS_PDF_SURFACE
  9860   if (NILP (type) || EQ (type, Qpdf))
  9861     surface_type = CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_PDF;
  9862   else
  9863 #endif
  9864 #ifdef CAIRO_HAS_PNG_FUNCTIONS
  9865   if (EQ (type, Qpng))
  9866     {
  9867       if (!NILP (XCDR (frames)))
  9868         error ("PNG export cannot handle multiple frames.");
  9869       surface_type = CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_IMAGE;
  9870     }
  9871   else
  9872 #endif
  9873 #ifdef CAIRO_HAS_PS_SURFACE
  9874   if (EQ (type, Qpostscript))
  9875     surface_type = CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_PS;
  9876   else
  9877 #endif
  9878 #ifdef CAIRO_HAS_SVG_SURFACE
  9879   if (EQ (type, Qsvg))
  9880     {
  9881       /* For now, we stick to SVG 1.1.  */
  9882       if (!NILP (XCDR (frames)))
  9883         error ("SVG export cannot handle multiple frames.");
  9884       surface_type = CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_SVG;
  9885     }
  9886   else
  9887 #endif
  9888     error ("Unsupported export type");
  9889 
  9890   return x_cr_export_frames (frames, surface_type);
  9891 }
  9892 
  9893 #ifdef USE_GTK
  9894 DEFUN ("x-page-setup-dialog", Fx_page_setup_dialog, Sx_page_setup_dialog, 0, 0, 0,
  9895        doc: /* Pop up a page setup dialog.
  9896 The current page setup can be obtained using `x-get-page-setup'.  */)
  9897      (void)
  9898 {
  9899   block_input ();
  9900   xg_page_setup_dialog ();
  9901   unblock_input ();
  9902 
  9903   return Qnil;
  9904 }
  9905 
  9906 DEFUN ("x-get-page-setup", Fx_get_page_setup, Sx_get_page_setup, 0, 0, 0,
  9907        doc: /* Return the value of the current page setup.
  9908 The return value is an alist containing the following keys:
  9909 
  9910   orientation: page orientation (symbol `portrait', `landscape',
  9911         `reverse-portrait', or `reverse-landscape').
  9912   width, height: page width/height in points not including margins.
  9913   left-margin, right-margin, top-margin, bottom-margin: print margins,
  9914         which is the parts of the page that the printer cannot print
  9915         on, in points.
  9916 
  9917 The paper width can be obtained as the sum of width, left-margin, and
  9918 right-margin values if the page orientation is `portrait' or
  9919 `reverse-portrait'.  Otherwise, it is the sum of width, top-margin,
  9920 and bottom-margin values.  Likewise, the paper height is the sum of
  9921 height, top-margin, and bottom-margin values if the page orientation
  9922 is `portrait' or `reverse-portrait'.  Otherwise, it is the sum of
  9923 height, left-margin, and right-margin values.  */)
  9924      (void)
  9925 {
  9926   Lisp_Object result;
  9927 
  9928   block_input ();
  9929   result = xg_get_page_setup ();
  9930   unblock_input ();
  9931 
  9932   return result;
  9933 }
  9934 
  9935 DEFUN ("x-print-frames-dialog", Fx_print_frames_dialog, Sx_print_frames_dialog, 0, 1, "",
  9936        doc: /* Pop up a print dialog to print the current contents of FRAMES.
  9937 FRAMES should be nil (the selected frame), a frame, or a list of
  9938 frames (each of which corresponds to one page).  Each frame should be
  9939 visible.
  9940 
  9941 Note: Text drawn with the `x' font backend is shown with hollow boxes.  */)
  9942      (Lisp_Object frames)
  9943 {
  9944   Lisp_Object rest, tmp;
  9945 
  9946   if (!CONSP (frames))
  9947     frames = list1 (frames);
  9948 
  9949   tmp = Qnil;
  9950   for (rest = frames; CONSP (rest); rest = XCDR (rest))
  9951     {
  9952       struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (XCAR (rest));
  9953       Lisp_Object frame;
  9954 
  9955       XSETFRAME (frame, f);
  9956       if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
  9957         error ("Frames to be printed must be visible.");
  9958       tmp = Fcons (frame, tmp);
  9959     }
  9960   frames = Fnreverse (tmp);
  9961 
  9962   /* Make sure the current matrices are up-to-date.  */
  9963   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  9964   specbind (Qredisplay_dont_pause, Qt);
  9965   redisplay_preserve_echo_area (32);
  9966   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  9967 
  9968   block_input ();
  9969   xg_print_frames_dialog (frames);
  9970   unblock_input ();
  9971 
  9972   return Qnil;
  9973 }
  9974 #endif  /* USE_GTK */
  9975 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  9976 
  9977 #ifdef USE_GTK
  9978 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
  9979 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 14, 0)
  9980 DEFUN ("x-gtk-debug", Fx_gtk_debug, Sx_gtk_debug, 1, 1, 0,
  9981        doc: /* Toggle interactive GTK debugging.   */)
  9982   (Lisp_Object enable)
  9983 {
  9984   gboolean enable_debug = !NILP (enable);
  9985 
  9986   block_input ();
  9987   gtk_window_set_interactive_debugging (enable_debug);
  9988   unblock_input ();
  9989 
  9990   return NILP (enable) ? Qnil : Qt;
  9991 }
  9992 #endif /* GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 14, 0) */
  9993 #endif /* HAVE_GTK3 */
  9994 #endif  /* USE_GTK */
  9995 
  9996 DEFUN ("x-display-set-last-user-time", Fx_display_last_user_time,
  9997        Sx_display_set_last_user_time, 1, 2, 0,
  9998        doc: /* Set the last user time of TERMINAL to TIME-OBJECT.
  9999 TIME-OBJECT is the X server time, in milliseconds, of the last user
 10000 interaction.  This is the timestamp that `x-get-selection-internal'
 10001 will use by default to fetch selection data.
 10002 The optional second argument TERMINAL specifies which display to act
 10003 on.  TERMINAL should be a terminal object, a frame or a display name
 10004 (a string).  If TERMINAL is omitted or nil, that stands for the
 10005 selected frame's display.  */)
 10006   (Lisp_Object time_object, Lisp_Object terminal)
 10007 {
 10008   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 10009   uint32_t time;
 10010 
 10011   /* time should be a 32-bit integer, regardless of what the size of
 10012      the X type `Time' is on this system.  */
 10013   dpyinfo = check_x_display_info (terminal);
 10014   CONS_TO_INTEGER (time_object, uint32_t, time);
 10015 
 10016   x_set_last_user_time_from_lisp (dpyinfo, time);
 10017   return Qnil;
 10018 }
 10019 
 10020 DEFUN ("x-internal-focus-input-context", Fx_internal_focus_input_context,
 10021        Sx_internal_focus_input_context, 1, 1, 0,
 10022        doc: /* Focus and set the client window of all focused frames' GTK input context.
 10023 If FOCUS is nil, focus out and remove the client window instead.
 10024 This should be called from a variable watcher for `x-gtk-use-native-input'.  */)
 10025   (Lisp_Object focus)
 10026 {
 10027 #ifdef USE_GTK
 10028   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 10029   struct frame *f;
 10030   GtkWidget *widget;
 10031 
 10032   block_input ();
 10033   for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo; dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
 10034     {
 10035       f = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
 10036 
 10037       if (f)
 10038         {
 10039           widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f);
 10040 
 10041           if (!NILP (focus))
 10042             {
 10043               gtk_im_context_focus_in (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->im_context);
 10044               gtk_im_context_set_client_window (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->im_context,
 10045                                                 gtk_widget_get_window (widget));
 10046             }
 10047           else
 10048             {
 10049               gtk_im_context_focus_out (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->im_context);
 10050               gtk_im_context_set_client_window (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->im_context,
 10051                                                 NULL);
 10052             }
 10053         }
 10054     }
 10055   unblock_input ();
 10056 #endif
 10057 
 10058   return Qnil;
 10059 }
 10060 
 10061 #if 0
 10062 
 10063 DEFUN ("x-test-string-conversion", Fx_test_string_conversion,
 10064        Sx_test_string_conversion, 5, 5, 0,
 10065        doc: /* Perform tests on the XIM string conversion support.  */)
 10066   (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object position,
 10067    Lisp_Object direction, Lisp_Object operation, Lisp_Object factor)
 10068 {
 10069   struct frame *f;
 10070   XIMStringConversionCallbackStruct call_data;
 10071   XIMStringConversionText text;
 10072 
 10073   f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
 10074 
 10075   if (!FRAME_XIC (f))
 10076     error ("No XIC on FRAME!");
 10077 
 10078   CHECK_FIXNUM (position);
 10079   CHECK_FIXNUM (direction);
 10080   CHECK_FIXNUM (operation);
 10081   CHECK_FIXNUM (factor);
 10082 
 10083   /* xic_string_conversion_callback (XIC ic, XPointer client_data,
 10084      XIMStringConversionCallbackStruct *call_data)   */
 10085 
 10086   call_data.position = XFIXNUM (position);
 10087   call_data.direction = XFIXNUM (direction);
 10088   call_data.operation = XFIXNUM (operation);
 10089   call_data.factor = XFIXNUM (factor);
 10090   call_data.text = &text;
 10091 
 10092   block_input ();
 10093   xic_string_conversion_callback (FRAME_XIC (f), NULL,
 10094                                   &call_data);
 10095   unblock_input ();
 10096 
 10097   /* Place a breakpoint here to inspect TEXT! */
 10098 
 10099   while (1)
 10100     maybe_quit ();
 10101 
 10102   return Qnil;
 10103 }
 10104 
 10105 #endif
 10106 
 10107 
 10108 /***********************************************************************
 10109                             Initialization
 10110  ***********************************************************************/

 10173 
 10174 /* Some versions of libX11 don't have symbols for a few functions we
 10175    need, so define replacements here.  */
 10176 
 10177 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 10178 #ifndef HAVE_XKBREFRESHKEYBOARDMAPPING
 10179 Status
 10180 XkbRefreshKeyboardMapping (XkbMapNotifyEvent *event)
 10181 {
 10182   return Success;
 10183 }
 10184 #endif
 10185 
 10186 #ifndef HAVE_XKBFREENAMES
 10187 void
 10188 XkbFreeNames (XkbDescPtr xkb, unsigned int which, Bool free_map)
 10189 {
 10190   return;
 10191 }
 10192 #endif
 10193 #endif
 10194 
 10195 #ifndef HAVE_XDISPLAYCELLS
 10196 int
 10197 XDisplayCells (Display *dpy, int screen_number)
 10198 {
 10199   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
 10200 
 10201   if (!dpyinfo)
 10202     emacs_abort ();
 10203 
 10204   /* Not strictly correct, since the display could be using a
 10205      non-default visual, but it satisfies the callers we need to care
 10206      about.  */
 10207   return dpyinfo->visual_info.colormap_size;
 10208 }
 10209 #endif
 10210 
 10211 #ifndef HAVE_XDESTROYSUBWINDOWS
 10212 int
 10213 XDestroySubwindows (Display *dpy, Window w)
 10214 {
 10215   Window root, parent, *children;
 10216   unsigned int nchildren, i;
 10217 
 10218   if (XQueryTree (dpy, w, &root, &parent, &children,
 10219                   &nchildren))
 10220     {
 10221       for (i = 0; i < nchildren; ++i)
 10222         XDestroyWindow (dpy, children[i]);
 10223       XFree (children);
 10224     }
 10225 
 10226   return 0;
 10227 }
 10228 #endif
 10229

 10243

 10263 
 10264   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-pointer-shape", Vx_pointer_shape,
 10265     doc: /* The shape of the pointer when over text.
 10266 Changing the value does not affect existing frames
 10267 unless you set the mouse color.  */);

 10273 This variable takes effect when you create a new frame
 10274 or when you set the mouse color.  */);

 10370     doc: /* A string indicating the foreground color of the cursor box.  */);
 10371   Vx_cursor_fore_pixel = Qnil;
 10372
