 10374     doc: /* Maximum size for tooltips.
 10375 Value is a pair (COLUMNS . ROWS).  Text larger than this is clipped.  */);
 10376   Vx_max_tooltip_size = Qnil;
 10377 
 10378   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-no-window-manager", Vx_no_window_manager,
 10379     doc: /* Non-nil if no X window manager is in use.
 10380 Emacs doesn't try to figure this out; this is always nil
 10381 unless you set it to something else.  */);
 10382   /* We don't have any way to find this out, so set it to nil
 10383      and maybe the user would like to set it to t.  */
 10384   Vx_no_window_manager = Qnil;
 10385 
 10386   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-pixel-size-width-font-regexp",
 10387                Vx_pixel_size_width_font_regexp,
 10388     doc: /* Regexp matching a font name whose width is the same as `PIXEL_SIZE'.
 10389 
 10390 Since Emacs gets the width of a font matching this regexp from the
 10391 PIXEL_SIZE field of the name, the font-finding mechanism gets faster for
 10392 such a font.  This is especially effective for large fonts such as
 10393 Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.  */);
 10394   Vx_pixel_size_width_font_regexp = Qnil;
 10395 
 10396 /* This is not ifdef:ed, so other builds than GTK can customize it.  */
 10397   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-gtk-use-old-file-dialog", x_gtk_use_old_file_dialog,
 10398     doc: /* Non-nil means prompt with the old GTK file selection dialog.
 10399 If nil or if the file selection dialog is not available, the new GTK file
 10400 chooser is used instead.  To turn off all file dialogs set the
 10401 variable `use-file-dialog'.  */);
 10402   x_gtk_use_old_file_dialog = false;
 10403 
 10404   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-gtk-show-hidden-files", x_gtk_show_hidden_files,
 10405     doc: /* If non-nil, the GTK file chooser will by default show hidden files.
 10406 Note that this is just the default, there is a toggle button on the file
 10407 chooser to show or not show hidden files on a case by case basis.  */);
 10408   x_gtk_show_hidden_files = false;
 10409 
 10410   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-gtk-file-dialog-help-text", x_gtk_file_dialog_help_text,
 10411     doc: /* If non-nil, the GTK file chooser will show additional help text.
 10412 If more space for files in the file chooser dialog is wanted, set this to nil
 10413 to turn the additional text off.  */);
 10414   x_gtk_file_dialog_help_text = true;
 10415 
 10416   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-gtk-resize-child-frames", x_gtk_resize_child_frames,
 10417     doc: /* If non-nil, resize child frames specially with GTK builds.
 10418 If this is nil, resize child frames like any other frames.  This is the
 10419 default and usually works with most desktops.  Some desktop environments
 10420 (GNOME shell in particular when using the mutter window manager),
 10421 however, may refuse to resize a child frame when Emacs is built with
 10422 GTK3.  For those environments, the two settings below are provided.
 10423 
 10424 If this equals the symbol `hide', Emacs temporarily hides the child
 10425 frame during resizing.  This approach seems to work reliably, may
 10426 however induce some flicker when the frame is made visible again.
 10427 
 10428 If this equals the symbol `resize-mode', Emacs uses GTK's resize mode to
 10429 always trigger an immediate resize of the child frame.  This method is
 10430 deprecated by GTK and may not work in future versions of that toolkit.
 10431 It also may freeze Emacs when used with other desktop environments.  It
 10432 avoids, however, the unpleasant flicker induced by the hiding approach.
 10433 
 10434 This variable is considered a temporary workaround and will be hopefully
 10435 eliminated in future versions of Emacs.  */);
 10436   x_gtk_resize_child_frames = Qnil;
 10437 
 10438   /* Tell Emacs about this window system.  */
 10439   Fprovide (Qx, Qnil);
 10440 
 10441   /* Used by Fx_show_tip.  */
 10442   DEFSYM (Qrun_at_time, "run-at-time");
 10443   DEFSYM (Qx_hide_tip, "x-hide-tip");
 10444 
 10445   /* Used by display class and backing store reporting functions.  */
 10446   DEFSYM (Qalways, "always");
 10447   DEFSYM (Qwhen_mapped, "when-mapped");
 10448   DEFSYM (Qnot_useful, "not-useful");
 10449   DEFSYM (Qstatic_gray, "static-gray");
 10450   DEFSYM (Qgray_scale, "gray-scale");
 10451   DEFSYM (Qstatic_color, "static-color");
 10452   DEFSYM (Qpseudo_color, "pseudo-color");
 10453   DEFSYM (Qtrue_color, "true-color");
 10454   DEFSYM (Qdirect_color, "direct-color");
 10455   DEFSYM (Qgrayscale, "grayscale");
 10456   DEFSYM (Qcolor, "color");
 10457

 10459   DEFSYM (Qxinput2, "xinput2");
 10460 
 10461   Fprovide (Qxinput2, Qnil);
 10462 #endif
 10463 
 10464 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 10465   Fprovide (intern_c_string ("x-toolkit"), Qnil);
 10466 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 10467   Fprovide (intern_c_string ("motif"), Qnil);
 10468 
 10469   DEFVAR_LISP ("motif-version-string", Vmotif_version_string,
 10470                doc: /* Version info for LessTif/Motif.  */);
 10471   Vmotif_version_string = build_string (XmVERSION_STRING);
 10472 #endif /* USE_MOTIF */
 10473 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 10474 
 10475 #ifdef USE_GTK
 10476   /* Provide x-toolkit also for GTK.  Internally GTK does not use Xt so it
 10477      is not an X toolkit in that sense (USE_X_TOOLKIT is not defined).
 10478      But for a user it is a toolkit for X, and indeed, configure
 10479      accepts --with-x-toolkit=gtk.  */
 10480   Fprovide (intern_c_string ("x-toolkit"), Qnil);
 10481   Fprovide (intern_c_string ("gtk"), Qnil);
 10482 
 10483   DEFVAR_LISP ("gtk-version-string", Vgtk_version_string,
 10484                doc: /* Version info for GTK+.  */);
 10485   {
 10486     char gtk_version[sizeof ".." + 3 * INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 10487     int len = sprintf (gtk_version, "%d.%d.%d",
 10488                        GTK_MAJOR_VERSION, GTK_MINOR_VERSION, GTK_MICRO_VERSION);
 10489     Vgtk_version_string = make_pure_string (gtk_version, len, len, false);
 10490   }
 10491 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 10492 
 10493 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 10494   Fprovide (intern_c_string ("cairo"), Qnil);
 10495 
 10496   DEFVAR_LISP ("cairo-version-string", Vcairo_version_string,
 10497                doc: /* Version info for cairo.  */);
 10498   {
 10499     char cairo_version[sizeof ".." + 3 * INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 10500     int len = sprintf (cairo_version, "%d.%d.%d",
 10501                        CAIRO_VERSION_MAJOR, CAIRO_VERSION_MINOR,
 10502                        CAIRO_VERSION_MICRO);
 10503     Vcairo_version_string = make_pure_string (cairo_version, len, len, false);
 10504   }
 10505 #endif

 10556   tip_timer = Qnil;

 10559   staticpro (&tip_frame);
 10560   tip_last_frame = Qnil;
 10561   staticpro (&tip_last_frame);
 10562   tip_last_string = Qnil;
 10563   staticpro (&tip_last_string);
 10564   tip_last_parms = Qnil;
 10565   staticpro (&tip_last_parms);
 10566   tip_dx = Qnil;
 10567   staticpro (&tip_dx);
 10568   tip_dy = Qnil;
 10569   staticpro (&tip_dy);
 10570 
 10571   defsubr (&Sx_uses_old_gtk_dialog);
 10572 #if defined (USE_MOTIF) || defined (USE_GTK)
 10573   defsubr (&Sx_file_dialog);
 10574 #endif
 10575 
 10576 #if defined (USE_GTK) && defined (HAVE_FREETYPE)
 10577   defsubr (&Sx_select_font);
 10578 #endif
 10579 
 10580   defsubr (&Sx_internal_focus_input_context);
 10581 
 10582 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 10583   defsubr (&Sx_export_frames);
 10584 #ifdef USE_GTK
 10585   defsubr (&Sx_page_setup_dialog);
 10586   defsubr (&Sx_get_page_setup);
 10587   defsubr (&Sx_print_frames_dialog);
 10588 #endif
 10589 #endif
 10590 #ifdef USE_GTK
 10591 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 10592 #if GTK_CHECK_VERSION (3, 14, 0)
 10593   defsubr (&Sx_gtk_debug);
 10594 #endif
 10595 #endif
 10596 #endif
 10597 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
